釋義: a step, a pace from 標示不清
the stalk or stem of coarse grass
a lady's fillet for the hair
a small boat or sampan
the sea
pinang: or betel nut
travelling apparatus: from Ma-bissas, to make ready
ashes, or cinders
rust; ach o dippa, the rust of iron; ach o barrieg, the rustof copper; ach, and inach, ino-ach-en, injured by rust
five and five, by fives
a fire place
the body
not yet; as acho aban ja ing, rummies mammabas, I do not yet know it, by and bye I shall know it; witten also achai, and achipa
enough

a certain small bird, less than a sparrow; variegated with a long tail; from whose cry future good or bad fortune may be presumed: if it cries out twice, or four times, it betokens misfortune; but if once, or thrice, or five times, then good success; if anything above this, it initiates a still greater blessing, according to the number of cries.
a part or share; from mada, to divide
a coral chain; it may be of poor materials, but much prized by the natives
中文: 一條珊瑚鏈； 它的材料可能很差，但很受當地人的喜愛

釋義: the roof the house

paddy; used for that production in its various stages. Numatojóarien, as it just shoots forth. Minochûrgaro, as it puts forth a broad leaf. Tummaabbi-alallabach, as it has two leaflets on the side, and one on the top; a resemblance being supposed to lallabach, a green leek.  Madocka jû adda, as it is now, 1+1/2  or 2 spans high: gûmmasor, túmmûbaron summatis, when it has attained its full length. Tummedinnid, when the grain begins to form. Pûikon ja adda, when the grain is perfect and hangs bent down. Tummaberook ja adda, when the grain is half  ripe and nearly scorched.
a piece; adda o ariem, a piece of a lemon: from paddat, to cut or break.
the palm of the hand
a crab
all kinds of missile weapons, as javelins, pikes: &c. from magga, to cast
中文: 各種發射性武器 (標槍、長茅)

釋義: seems to mean, it is done, when any end is reached
seems that, here, but not far off; ai-i, ai-ies, ai-inies, ailo, ailo-ies, and ailemons, the same
a cockroach
there, but not far off. Aicho, aichoies, soo aicho echies, yonder. Pait o ta, so-o roman kallach, gannumma, there, beyond, yonder. Paia innai maro maicho, and mai-hoies, it is so, there it is.
中文: 那裏、距離不遠 之處

釋義: beyond, outside, far out of sight
small stars
the following; a-i-or natta, the next; ajor narroa, &c. A-i-or a mato, next after the large one, that is smaller.
to suppose, to imagine.

is frequently used in different senses; if we meet with this expression alone, it seems to intimate the doing away with anything, as when anything is burnt: aissen o chau, it is burnt in the fire; aissen o cho, some one has taken it away.
as chadsja pila, nearly hit
seven and seven, by seven
a word of excuse, when you unknowingly run against any one; as pray excuse me.
a form of complaint, when any thing falls down
a hunting net, placed in the field, to catch beasts; from pakobor, to catch in a net
show finery, ornament; from Malla or Pallo, to set one's self off.
by and bye
called in the south, kalladóch, a sort of red beans, which the natives wear round their necks, instead of coral beads; they are very posonous.
that, in order that
kindness; from ma-allal, to be kind
all kinds of projeciles or missle weapons; from Malam, to fight with missle weapons.
a basket , also a werd used in addressing children
added to a word betokens doing or suffering; it also refers to the future. Súmmada, allecho na-amai, which is the same as sunmada na-a mamai, tomorrow  I will come
fire-wood; as marach o ûllolo, go and get some fire-wood.
a barri, a whirlwind
a prohibitory expression, as ûmi a mochan, bring no food; ûmi a maú a dat-ai, do not pick it.
the north. Matamis-mi-ma, northward. Patamis, transit.
a plum, a plum tree
the liver

before  this. ago; ani rúmmies, in former days; ani zchieta rummies, ten days ago; aninaspaat ai das, four months ago; ani tarnacho a baas, nine years ago: animúnma, and anibanno, when did it happen? People say in the evening; ani mûrpesa, yesterday, or last evening: ani naassa, a little while ago; anissima, this morning early: annach, certainly, verily: ansia, yesterday: ansiûtta, the day before yesterday: ani bi-ini, and anbini, last night: anibaas, last year: ani mossa, like anibaas, like anibaas: animilip, a long time ago: aniaicho, d'cicin ani, a very long since.

go on, go forward: anno
man noma taitum madp, get to work;
maibas pattillo ta-i, ta-i man, maibas
channa, Pray eat.

as mumma annuma; Sassonoe,
what are you grumbling about.
pickle

maorran, ino-a-orran, fuddled
with drinking, sick; people also say
madich a mairab a-orran ja ina.

salt and water, with which
the natives wash their wounds. Com
pounded of ao, pickle, and soI, a
wound.
a measure, an ell; from moet

an adopted child, a servant
brought up in the house but who works
for his food; as aran o cho, to serve for
one's board and lodging

a sack, in which the natives
when they travel, put their food and
clothing, to carry it on their backs.

two and two, ararroa don natta cho tumkach, from every second
house is some one gone out to hunt
grass

a kind of breeches made of the
bark of a tree.
tow, lint.
a tub, a barrel.

all sorts of hunting appara
tus, as bows, arrows, fishnets, &c.
from maribaribat, to hunt, or to go a
fishing.
a lemon, or citron of every kind.
a trevet

a place of as
sembly; arorroan ata, a plain for
meeting; arorroan adon, a meeting
house; arorróan bonna, a field for
meeting; from marorro, together, in
Common.
the breast

a fence; from parar, to fence
round.

the full moon, that is
a clear moon; from parara, to enlighten.
a clod of earth

from inaribodán, or ino-ar-rihodan, to cast the skin, to moult;
from Paribod
everything belonging to dress or ornament

the neck, and the back
part of the head.

a household: cho don takalla
aréddan, takalla, a family. 
Arima, great bamboos.
as Bajan: 1. mataris, easterly.  2.pataris, transit

a centipede: arripas mahahasis,
arripas gagil, this is a very rare kind:
arripasmorrún, is arripas a bivog, of
this sort there are more.
a native armring of iron or copper;also a certain instrument wherewith to pluck up grass. Callaba, the ring of round copper wire on the fore part of the arm. Tallatuis, the second ring underneath.

the rump of a man or beast; as
taddogon, is understood of the upper
part of the body, without neck or
head, including the ribs and breast,
whether there be flesh on or not.
from inimarros-t' a-arnaros-os,the noise of the sea; from Parros-os, not in use.
the sea roars,
a kind of shield
any vehicle borne between two, as a bier, &c. from Passabo, to carry between two.
the sides of a house
the seam of a garment: from Passopietpiet, to hem.
a cast net: from Passopir, to fish with a castnet.
laziness, idleness: from Masas, lazy, slow.
four and four, by fours
a barnfloor, where people beat seed out of the stock: from Mdsdū, to thresh.
a sieve.
a post in the middle of a house.
the leg of a man or beast: asiél o sijsia, rays of the sun.
a handkerchief: from Passinok, to blow the nose.
a nail of the finger
a large kind of bean
a gift, a present: from Pâssoso, given.
a village
as annomdinnoma, go forward! &c
a picture, also a letter: from pattas, to write.
a scare crow, for frightening
ten and ten, by tens.

until; as jo tatümmaap ate o lal. lias, you must work till midday; at
poa ja kallaman ate cabat, fill the poet half full.away birds: from Pattázies, to make
8 SCalle CrOW.
six and six, by sixes.
nine and nine, by nines.

a medicine: from Pattauso, to
heal.
a lesson: from Pattil, to learn; atillaijas, school, church, &c.

a command; from Patillo, to
order.

a sparrow net: from Pattipo, to
shoot.
a word, a speech, an oration to the people, a sermon: from Pattite, to speak openly to the people;

sets forth the special relation between sister and brother; thus from this word, a brother is called not after his brother, but his sister; and a sister, not with reference to her sister, but her brother.

a patch, anything used for the stopping of a hole or tear, whether sewed. darmed, or woven in. From Pattap.
to stop a hole or tear.
three and three, by threes.
either; one by one.
a mast
a caltrop

a sign by which one calls to another, as, ho! but it is generally placed after the name of the individual called, as
cabbat, or cabba, at ; ho! cabba.
a basket for catching fish, nearly like a net.
cocks' spurs.
a swelling or thickness, in any part of the body. See Ponno, a boil, or swelling that comes of its self.
joy, love: from Maûkat, to love.
a stopper of a tankard or kan: from Pokkor, to put on a stopper.
the kidneys
fright, astonishment.
wax.
a chinese water pot, such as are seen in the junks.

a way or course, leading any
where: as, dema aw soam mosse
bat-adai, where are they going after Bat-a?
a measure or instrument where measure with, as salt, &c. From Moct.
an opinion, a suspicion, a feeling; from Poetat, to suspect.

a table on which people eat.
Ataz aûman, idem.
a board or tray, on which to put cups and saucers.
strangers, who do not belong to our town or country.
an enemy: from Mazjies, enmity.
a treasure: from Mazimán, to lay up treasures.
half full.
a stool
unemployed, plain, private, out of service, or anything unserviceable.
the superficies, or circumference of anything, whether outside or in; báan olellum, báan o babo.
a year.
a fruit, something like the European pumpkin.
a melon.
a water melon.
a pumpkin
tidings, a message. From Paas, to bring tidings.
folly, contention.
a fool; as raúsaán, and rachoen, not wise, half silly.
the fever. Also the verb. prete. binachinan, fut. ino bachiman.
a load, also a pair; it is only used of such things, as by nature or art are coupled together. Nata bachan a babat aeharrod, a pair of shoes or stockings.
dryness.

joined to sjoem, a child, refers to all children of the male kind, whether of man or beast; when used alone it betokens a full grown male among
beasts: and among the men, a bachelor; we say bachelor, because after marriage the name of badda is no longer given. From this comes, bas a badda, a great boy; and babat a badda, a half grown young man.
persons born on the same day.
a wave, a billow.
horns; figuratively, a buck; otherwise, o basan.
a fruit, like small cucumbers.
the muscles above the thick part of the leg. measure with, as salt, &c. From Moet.
the muscles under the armpits.
a coral
the lungs.
a live coal.
the east.
a storm: from the verb Pajûs, to storm; transit. pabajûs.
a double row. From Palat, to spread one's self out twice.
a hanger
new, young.
the new moon.
the south wind.
the outer props, on which the ridge pole rests, All the props of a ridge, whether in the middle, or at the end. .
the dewlap of a cow
a wood, or forest
the shaft of a pen.
the wind: from Mabárri, to blow.
naked: from pabarra barra, to strip naked.
an iron pan
the remainder, the overplus: ka -' barras okoste, ja merien, ka barras o natta chosar o baddo, there is very little left to do, there is only one man
the nostrils.
the buttocks
ink, also a letter or book; generally all kinds of lampblack, adhering to pots or chimnies. From Pido, to write.
scurfy, scabbyness. Bigh-en, scabby.
scum: from Pigenó, to foam.
the night.
a young pig.
a split, a break, in anything hard, a cleft: from Pilla, to cleave.
a fellow, a soldier, young fellows who have beaten the enemy are thus called by the natives.
the breadth of anything.
this is pronounced like billaák, a split bamboo.
coarse cloth woven by the natives, also sail cloth.
a plantain tree; bá o bilpil, a plantain.
a small plantain with a red skin
a long plantain.
another sort tolerably
a small plantain with a thin skin.
a hog spear, a broad pike.
a deer, whether buck or doe
all kinds of juice, in which any food, whether fish or flesh is cooked; or it may be pickled, in order to pre serve it.
thunder. Poa bioa, it thunders.
tiles. .
as barras, superfluous.
a dart. .
see roddok, a common kind of dart.
see tallapiech, a large dart.
a long piece or end broken or cut off from the length of anything; it differs from borbor and kattach.
a word used when anything is pulled, cut, or broken in pieces, as if people very much moved, exclaimed, it is all over. : Seegiech, to tear, and ossot, to plunder.
all kinds of seed or fruit of a tree or plant; also the flesh of beasts and fishes. Ba-o, the dregs of native liquor. Also a person.
a tankard.
live coal
a beetle.

to appease, to be at peace; boor' azies, allies: from Maborro, peace
and Aborro, to pacify.
dust: from Porpor, to raise the dust
large spots, with which mer. are sometimes born. Also the stains with which drinkers soil their clothes.
verb binorrason, fut. inoborrason, g. borrasoa, to become mouldy, and spoiled: borrason a uppo, mouldy bread.
a wen
a sort of hard reed, with which the natives make darts.
everything that projects above another. Maborroch mi, ma, verb.
a boil on the nose.
an island.
the edge of a table.
a word used when anything is drawn out, as if we should say, It is out; also when any one comes forward, as bossot ja icho, he is come .forward. Pabossot, to draw out.
the root of a tree, or plant,
a cat.
a musk-cat, so called because it eats paddy in the field.
the trunk of a human body, without the head.
a bow.
a swelling under the ball of the foot.
a feather, or wing.
the belly
adultery: from chumma.
, the calf of the leg.
a saw: from chummëriel, to saw.

almost: chadsia madich, almost sick: chadsja macha, almost dead: chadsja man ja ina, I have nearly had enough: as olachal adsia, olochaladsja, olamamoeda, all these
words are of similar signification, and appear to denote a kind of complaining: olamamoeda, olachadsja macha, he is nearly dead.
the refuse of bruised corn.
a small napkin of silk or woollen.
a besom. From chummaú to sweep.

any kind of covering to shut
up any thing, as the lid of a pot, pan, chest or canmster. also a door or window

the premises round a house,
within the fence.

the space between the lattice.
Chárrima, the ears.

詞條: Charri o zijsia, o idas, o baar,
釋義: some days, months, or years, but not all.
stagnant water. Repeated, char chareo, full of marshes and pools.
stockings.
a bat.
tobacco.
fire.

enough, as achoa, and ami, a
a word whereby men signify that they desire no more: it differs from kamicho, and o chal.
the great gut.

chinummacho, chachummacho, g.
chacho-o, I. 
chachon, chinûcho, inochach-on, to polish.
Pachacho, to polish, &c.
Cho chummacho; inochachon, bato achoan;
the man polishes; the knife is whetted;
the stone grinds it sharp.
Chachach-o, a grinding; ma-acha *cha_h-o,
a grindstone.

chi, cha, chaddikka, chûddikken, chinaddik,
ino-chàddikken, to approach.
Pachaddik, to draw near: chachaddik, an approach:
ma-achachaddik, activ. any one who comes near:
activ. ma-achaddik, coming near. From machaddik,
chaddik, the drawing near of a matter.

chinummad, chachúmmad, g. chadda, I.
chadden, chinad, inochadden, 
retribution, whether good or bad;
pachad, transit: chachad, reward: 
ma-achachad, a rewarder.

chi, cha, chaddippa, 
to cut off any thing close to the ground.
中文:
拔/割掉接近地面的東西（？）
（類似拔草、除草？農作物？）

釋義:
chinummagchil, chachummagchil, g. chachilla, I.
chagchillan, chimagchillan, inochagchillan, 
to come up with any one in walking or running.
Pachachil, chachûchchil, nom. subst.
ma-achûchachil, a good runner that can overtake others.
中文: 遇見正在走路、跑步的人

釋義:
chinummai, chachûmmai, g.
chai-a, *I. cha-in, chinai, inochaittin,
to carry on the back.
Pachai, transit: chachai, nomen. subst. ma-achachai;

chi, cha, challakka, chilakken, chimallak, inochallakken,
to cover over, as 'tummakken; achallak, transit.

chi, cho, chaisa, pass.
chaisas, a putting off. Pachais, transit.

chinummallam, *chachummałlam, g.
challama, any thing that lies over another, as clothes, &c.
Also to hang or put one thing over another.
中文:
(v.)堆疊、使重疊
(n.)疊在一起的東西（？）如衣服

釋義:
chi, cha, chalgalla, the barking of dogs.
Pachalgal, transit.
Chachalgal, gebas nom. ma-achchalgal, to bark.

chi, cha, *channagha, channaghan, chinannaghan, 
inochannaghan, 
to make a notch in an arrow in order to fix it on the string.
中文: 在箭上刻凹痕，使其能固定成一串

釋義:
chinmumaniod, chachummanied, g. *channida,
the screaming, howling, and crying, whether of children 
or adults.
中文:
（大人或小孩的）
尖叫聲、吼叫聲、哭喊聲

釋義:
chinûmmalt, chachûmmalt, g. chatta. I. chattan, chinattan,
inochattan, to pay a ransom for a murderer: according to 
the old native custom, a pig for a man. Also to pay a fine 
for any misdeed. Pachalt, transit. to do as above: also 
simply to give back or repay one thing for another, like for 
like, whatever it be: chachalt, the punishment laid on any
one a ransom for murderer. Also the judgment that is 
annexed to murder. Atea *zi_sja o chachalt o tapos o cho,
the day of general judgment. Ma-achachalt, a ransomer;
that is, one who pays the ransom.
中文: 付贖金給歹徒；付罰款；償還

釋義:
chinummappachappa, chachûmmappachappa, g.
chappachappa, stubborn, shameless, haughty;
to hawl and tear in a quarrelsome manner: 
chiummaappachappo, cho, maibas, chammabal, 
chachappachappa, stubbornness; ma-achachappachappa,
a stubborn, troublesome person.

chinûmmacha, chachûmmûcha, chachachachûan, chinacha,
inochachaas, to look for, to seek out. Pachacha, pi, pa,
apachûcha, ipachacha, inipachacha, ino-ipachacha,
to search out: piri mario. Chummacho o arribel, o naùpoot,
to look out for good clothes: chummacho'mammal, to look
out for a lover; it is used for men as well as things. Chachûcha,
a searching out: maachachacha, to seek out.

chinummachcho, chachûmmachcho, chachchoa, chachchoan,
chinachchóau, inochachchoan, to wash with lye.
Pachûchcho, pinachachcho, papachachcho, ipachachchoa,
ipachachcho, inipachachcho, inoipachachcho, to do as above.
Chummach cho-no riba, to wash clothes.
Ma-achachachcho, a washerman. Chach-cho, lye to wash with.

chinûmmar, chachûmmûr, g. charra, I. charren, chinar, inocharren.
inochûan, to burn up. Pachar, transit. Cho chummar aras baron, 
don charren; or chaan, chauman, people have set the grass on
fire, and it is burnt; the fire consumes. Chúchar paga chûchar
assaban, there is a fire in the village; ma-achachar, one who sets
any thing on fire.

chinummeocheo, chachúmmeocheo, cheoche-óa, cheocheoon,
chineocheoon, inocheocheoon, to bore a hold a little wider, 
as with a knife, the point of a bill, &c. Pacheocheo, pinacheocheo, 
papacheocheo, ipacheocheóa, ipacheocheo, inipûcheocheo,
ino-ipacheocheo, to do as above.

chi. cha, charaddoa, charaddoon, chinaradodo, inocharadodoon,
the same as rûmmarro, to encircle. Pacharûdodo, transit.
chacharadodo. nom. chûmmarapo, chi, cha, charopoa,
charapoon, chinarapo, inocharapoon, to cover a chamber with 
ant thing; to guard the window with a bamboo: chacharapo, from
Pacharapo, a covering, or placing.
chi, cha, charillochilloa, the writhing of snakes.

chinummarop, chachûmmaróp, g. charoppa, l. charóppan,
inicharop, inocharoppan, to gather amd take up with the hands,
as rice, barley; also to rake dirt together. Pacharop, transit.
from chacharop, such scraping together; ma-achacharop,
to scrape anything.
same as chûmmallam
中文:
(v.)堆疊、使重疊 
(n.)疊在一起的東西（？）如衣服

釋義:
chinummarrod, chachummarrod, g: charrodda, to put on one's
stockings. Pacharrod, pi, pa, ipacharodda, &c. charroddas,
chinarroddan, ino-charroddan; charroddan ja asiel, 
he legs are covered with stockings. 
Charrod, ipacharrod, the stockings are on.
Charrod, stockings; ipacharrodoxia, put on the child's stockings.

chinûmmaschas, chachûmmaschas, g. chaschàssa, I. 
chaschassen, chinaschas, inochaschassen, 
to scrape any thing even.

chinummat, chachûmmat, it is high water; but this is only said of the
sea, and not of rivers. It is used when the water stands still, and 
does not flow. Châchat, high water. Sabunno ja chúmmat ai?
When is it high water? Chûmmat ja to, it is high water.

chi, cha. chattûdda, chattaddan, chinattaddan. *inocha_taddan,
to shadow, to over shadow. Pachattad, transit. nom. chattad.
a shadowing. Chatta dan aijan, a shadowy place, 
a covering for the sun.

chinûmmaû, chachûmmaû, g: chau-u, I. chaûan, *chiuaû, *inochaúnan,
to sweep. Pachaû, transit. Chachaû; a besom: ma-achachaû, a sweeper:
chochûmmaû, the man sweeps. Chauan ja don, the house is swept.

chi, cha, cheda, chedûan, chienda, inochedûan, early in the season:
as Padaat, Pachdo', transit. nom. chachda, early time.
chinumme, chachumme, g. chía, to do that which is suitable.

chinummeriel, chachûmmeriel, to saw; cherila, cherilen, inocherilled.
Pacheriel, pi, pa, ipûcherilla. a saw.

chinûmmero, chachûmmero, g: chera, I. cheroan, chínero, inocheroon,
to make straight. As Pachero, transit. chûmmero-noties, chache-ro, nom.
sub. a making straight; also that by which any thing is made straight.

chinûmmi, chachûmmi, g. chia, I. chien, chini, inochieu, to bore a hole
with a bodkin. Chaegi, a bore.

chinûmmibar, chûchûmmibar, g. chibarra. I. chibarren, chinibar, 
mochibarreo, to stir about food in the cooking, that it may not be burned.
Also to row: Pachibar, chibûrren; inochan a bali, the food is well stirred;
the boat is rowed. Chachibar, a stiring about: chachibar o abak, the rowing
of a boat; ma-acha, chibar, a boatman, a rower.
中文:
攪拌食物（使不燒焦）；
划船

釋義:
chinummichi, chachûmmichi, g: ichichia, I: ichicha, inichicha, inochichi,
to pour in, to cast in, as in a pot, can, or bottle, &c. to pour out.
Pachichi, transit. from chumma. Otoichichi, the beer, wine, or water is
poured out. Chûmmichi, oto o bonoaad_ maibas tûmmis, chachichi,
a pouring out, or pouring in; chûche, chi oto, chamma, ma-achachichi,
a cup bearer.

chi, cha, chieddan, chidden, chinied, inochiëdden, to fence in, to inclose;
Porchied. transit. Chached, a fence; ma-achachied, to inclose.

chinummieg, chachummieg, g. chiegcha, I: chiegchegen, chiniegch,
inochiegchen, to roast; as summoso pachieg, chiegchen tsi biman,
the fish or flesh is fried. Chachieg, a roasting, or frying; maachachien, a fry.

chinûmmillip, chachûmmillip, g: chilippa, I. chilippen, chinilip, inochinilippen,
to cut with shears. Chummillip, naupoot, to cut linen; naupoot chilippen, the
linen is cut up. Chachilip, scissars; ma-achachilip, one who cuts with
scissars.

chinûmmimit, chachummimit, g: chimta, I. chimten, chinimit, inochimten,
to secure, to take care of, to protect, to rule, to take charge of. Pachimit,
transit. Ma-achachimt, a superintendent, a ruler. Chachimit, a rule.
Pachimit, to take care of. Pachimit o assaban, a garrison to take care of
a town.
the same as chûmmibar

chinummio, chachummio, chiou, chioan, chinio, inochioan, chummio, no-man,
michan patite, to do any thing when we do not want any one else near.
Chûmmio no cho, to get away the people: cho chioan, the people are gone.

chinûmmior, chachûmmior. to sport forth as trees.
Pachoir, transit. Gitas pûchior o barros, the rain makes the tress bud.
Chioor, a bud.

chinummischis, chachummischis, g: chischissa, l: chischissea, chinischis, 
inochischissen, to produce fire by the rubbing of two bamboos together.
Pûchischis, transitiv. Chûmmischis o chau: to produce fire.

chinûmmio, chachummo, *choachoon, chino, ino-choon; Pacho, transit.
to lace any thing with a string of rattan. Tairies choón o sarries chacho,
a birding together: chachono tairies,  a stringing of corals.

chinûmmoa, chachummonao, g. choa, I. choan, chinoa, inocho-an, 
to lace together. Pachoa, transit. Chachoa. a lacing together. 
*Chummoagagir, to lace the nets together, to fasten.

chinummine, chachummime, chemea, cheme-in, chineme, ino-cheme-in,
to press out pus from a *boil. Pûchemc, pinacheme, pûpûcheme, 
ipa-chemea, ipacheme. inipacheme, ino-ipacheme, to do as above. 
Chûmmime o soo, to press out a wound.
 Chemeis soa, the wound is pressed out. Cheme, pus.

chinumminoch, chachumminoch, chiuoch-a, chinoch-en, chininoch,
inochinochen, that which is disapproved of in anger, or cast away in contempt
Pachinoch, po, pa, ipachinocha, &c. to do as above. It betokens also to throw
away any thing in anger and break it into pieces.
中文:
（因憤怒、輕蔑）
被丟棄、驅逐的人事物

釋義:
chi, cha, chirra, chirron, chinir, inochirran, to hover as birds when they keep
their wings still. Pachier, to do as above. It is used also of trees or grass,
when they gently wave their heads.
中文:
如鳥般空中盤旋；
（樹、草等）擺動

釋義:
chirrlchen, chinirrich, inochirrichen, to draw a tight line. Pachirrich, pi, pa,
ipachirricha, ipachirrich, inipachirrich, ino-ipachirrich, to do as above.
Chûmmirrich, as kûmmirrich, chachirrich, a right line.
the same as chûmmibar

chinummomach, cha-chummomach, chomûcha, chomachen, chinomach,
inccho-machen, to rule. Chummomach o sassi, to salt. Fachomach, pipapa
chomach, ipachomach-a, ipachomach, inipachomach, ino-ipa chomach, to do
as above. Chummomach o abo, to plaster with lime.
中文: 統治；(用鹽)醃漬；用石灰覆蓋

釋義: chi, cha, to root, to poke.

chinummo-acho-ar, chachummo-acho-ar, g: cho-acho-arra, I: cho-acho-arren, 
chino-acho-ar, inocho-acho-arren, to mix one thing with another; to stir up from
the bottom, as chummibar. Pacho acho-ar, transit.

chinummobbechob, chachûmmobbechob, g: chobbechobba, I: chobbechobben,
chinobbechob, ino-chobbechobben, to tuck up, to strip up, as the sleeves of a coat.
Also to stir up to diligence in work. Pachobechoob, transit: chachobechoob, nomen.
Chummobechoob o tummaap, to stir up. Cho, chobechoben, chûmmobechoob, riba,
lili, o liba, the clothes or sleeves stripped up.
中文: 捲起袖子；打起精神努力

釋義:
chinûmmobon, chachûmmobon, g. echoboma, I. ichobon, inichobon, ino-chiobon, 
to put into the sheath, the sheath. Chobonnan, chinobonnan, inochobonnan. 
Pachobon, transit. Chobon, nomen. a sheath.

chinummod, chachûmmod, g: chodda, I: chodden, chinod, inochodden, to commit 
adultery, to seek an improper connection: or the improper connection itself.
Sai sini, sù chummod ina, mirab palro achachoa, sjiem, ____ is a woman come to
ask me to ______ her son go free. Pachod, transit. Chachod, whoredom, adultery.
Ma-achachad, a whoremonger, an adultery.
中文: 通姦；尋求不當（男女）關係

釋義:
chinummollichol, chachûmmollichol, g: chollicholla, I: chollichollen, chinollichol,
inochollichollen, to put out, to put away. Pachollichol, transit. Chachollichol, nomen.
中文: to put out, to put away

釋義:
chi, cha, chollietta, chollietten, inocholliën, inocholliëtten, 
the same as hûmmahimmotto; chachollien, nom. chûmmollicholp riba, to undress.
Chûmmollichol o bazigh, villen.

chinûmmollok, chachummollok, g: chollokka, I: chollokkan, chinollokkan, 
inochollokkan, to change things of the same sot one with another, whether openly
or in secret. Pachollok, transit. Chachollok, to exchange, barter, chachollok o arribil.

chi, cha, chinagha, chonaghen, chinonagh, ino-chonûghen, as lummalla.
Pachonagh, as lalala. Ma-achàchonag, als ma-alalala.

chinûmmoschos, chachummoschos, g: choschossa, I: choschossen, 
chinoschas inochoschossen, anything badly, or raggedly cut.
中文: 粗糙地剪/砍下來的東西

釋義: chi, cha, chonchonna, plough. Chachonchon, a ploughing.

chinummo-o, chachûmmo-o, to spring out of the ground. Pacho-o, pi, pa, ipachooa,
ipacho-o, inipacho-o ino-ipacho-o, to arise, to spring up. Cho-o, a sprout.

chinummomochomo, chachummomochómo, chomochómoa, chomochomoon,
chinomochomoon, inochomochomoon, to rub anything gently with the palm of the 
hand. Pachomochomo, to rub with the hand the place that itches.

chi, cha, choschosse, pass. choschossen. chinoschos, inochoschossen, 
idem tùmmachos. Pachoschos, transit.

chinummoté, chachummote, choten, chote, chinoté, inochoten, to punish; as tummea,
and pachote; chachoté, punishment. Ma-achachote, punishing.
a blow with a fist.

chinumpe, chachumpe, g: chuppea, I: chuppein, chinuppe, ino-chuppein, bamboos make
flat like boards. Pachuppe, transit.

chinumpir, chachumpir, chuppirra, chuppirren, chienpier, ino-chûppirren, to break through;
as men say, chunopir o arros, o to, o azijes, to push through the grass, the water, 
the enemy, &c. Pachûppir, pinachuppir, papachuppir, ipachûppirra, to do as above.
Chachuppir, a breaking through; chachuppir o to, the braking through of water.
chinumpod, chachumpod, to spring out of the ground, as water.
chi, cha, the shooting forth of many sprouts from the root.

chinumsan, chachûmsan, the in- and expiration of the breath. It differes from paucher,
which means to blow strongly; chachsas, nom. the breath.
a flttened piece of bamboo. From chumpé.
the woof. Chuppin o naupoot.
a well, a fountain. From chumpod.
an aflix, as macha-da, dead, dry; ma-bada, wize, to know.
a straw; after the seed is threshed out.
中文: 稻草(種子被取出來之後)

釋義: a dance, from dûmmalizi.
the crop of birds.

over, done: ka dagh ja zichil, the sorrow is over: ka dagh ja mapich, the fight is done:
ka dagh ja oba, the drowsiness is past.

the shadow or darkness which the clouds make on the ground, when they obscure the sun;
for otherwise the shdow of a tree is called eonno. Verbum, midach-um. Paidach-um, transit.
the stalk of plants, melons, &c.

cannot well be trasnlated(???): dakrap ja mampa, there sits the bird: innai bonna da mai
dakrap, I am come out of the field, and here I sit.
Darri dûrri, a clock.
the bank of a river; written dûtta: lallûbbo, lobbokas, the sea shore.
a double flute on which people plat with their nostrils.
the little finger.
a flying kite: as taz-i.
the blade of a sword or knife, to which the handle is fixed.
they.

any evil that we deserve, or have brought on ourselves; thus they say, jo a deeg, or dillij, it
is well arranged, you have your deserts.
who, what, which, where.
中文: 疑問詞（誰、什麼、哪一個、哪裏）

釋義:
indema, indea, inde, de, are all of one meaning, as pana dema, pana de, where are you going?
N. B. Nûmma is sometimes used for dema, as mosse-numma, for mosse-dema.
lest.
a sickness. From Madich.
all sorts of yound birds, just hatched and not yet fledged.

zinemmo, dadimmo, g. doa, I: doon, zinoon, inodoon, to pull upwards, to hoist, as people draw
water out of a well. Pado, transit. Dummono dale, to. draw up a pitcher: dale kadoon, means also
to take a pot off the fire.
iron.
a jungle full of reeds and rushes, such as grow on the banks of rivers and morasses.

manner, custom: kadogh, constume, ceremonies: kadóg o assaban, kadog o anibaas, maibas
madarrain.
a house, a great vessel.
to beat: ka doogh ja na öeno, my head beats; as tummok. Doogh has no tenses.
the lips

zinûmmaraû, tadûmmaraû, g. daraû-a, I. daraûn, zenaraû,inodaraun, to bend half round, 
to make a semi-circle. Padaraû, transit. modaraû, semi-circular: neutr. daddaraû, a semi-circle.
dsi, tad: dadacha; dadachen, &c. to climb. Padadach, transit.
to make into a circle; imp: daraûdaûn.

the same; imp. taribodiboa, modaaraûdaû, modaribodibo, like a circle; daddaraûdaû, 
daddaribodibo, a circle.

zinummaries, tadummarries, g: darriesa, I: idarries, inidarris, inoidarries, darriessan, inidarries, 
darriessan, to lock up, or fasten. Padarries, transit. chachap idarries, don darriessan: dandarries,
a lock.

zinummarrogigodoggo, tadûmmarogodoggo, g. darroggodoggo-a, to walk double, as old people
or those who are deformed do, to spy out anything. Maibas kakkollen. pikkon sies: 
daddarroggodoggo, nom. as ababad  pikkon, a hunch back.

to do anything in the place of another, or to succeed to one, dsi, tadum: imp. daua: nomen dau,
instead of another. Maanaû, one who comes in the place of another to do or suffer anything for them.

zinûmmaûko. tadúmmaûko, g. daûkóa, to lift up the head high, either because people can see with
difficulty, as mitébabo baak, or that they do it, inomaso kummeriel, to pay the more attention.
zinûmmo-an, inodùmmoan, to sweat. Dûmmoan ja ina, I sweat. Dûmmo, sweat.

zinûmmaûkàûka, tadûmmaûkaûka, g: daûkaûka-a, is said of drunkards who go staggering about the
streets.

zinûmméódeo, tadûmmeódeo, long and trailing, as a long garment, a long tail, long hair, &c.
Dûmeódeo, arriba, taa, the gown trails, the hair hangs long.

zinûmmeogh, tadûmmeogh, g: déogcha, I. deógchen, zineogh, inodeogchen, to brush, or rub off.
Dûmmeógo o sesnab, to brush down with a brush: dûmmeog o rima. to rub down with the band. 
Padeoch, transit. taddeoch, nomen. subst. Dûmmeogh o magcha, to rub the eyes: dûmmeogh o
nok, to blow the nose.

zinumbor, tadûmbor, doborra, doborren, zinobor, inodoborren, padabor, transit. to take away 
against one's will: as maûpis, poas: ka sai dumbor na mochan ja mado, the dog has taken away my
food; to constrain another to do any thing, either willingly or not; to hold fast, and not to left go:
as madabdab, elli pittol o meacha, dombor o maùmali o meroos. Dûmbor o arribil, dûmbor o cho,
to force any one, to take any thing away: nomen. subst. daddobor, daddobor o ballag, depriving
another of his goods. Ma addobor, an oppressor, a tyrant.

dsi: tad. dach-alla, dachûllen, zinach-al, ino-dach-allen, to turn over the over the ground with a
spade or hoe. Padach-al, daddach-al, a digging up, also a hoe. Ma ataddach-al, a digger.

zinummaggo, tadûmmaggo, imp. daggo-a, not to stand upright, to over hang; is generally said of men,
houses, trees, &c. padaggo, transit. Dummaggo, o moddan asjoddon, the gable or wall hangs over.
Tadaggo, nomen. subst.
dsi, tad, see tûmmakkal, to bind. Daddakkal, a ribbon, a bandage.
dsi: tadum: dalappa, to thatch a house with grass. that is when a portion of the old thatch remains.

h, zinûmmalimogh, tadûmmalimogh, is said of the sky, when it appears hazy as in a drizzling shower.
Dûmmalimogh o busûm.

zi, tad, dalizia, dalizian, zinalizau, inodalizian, to dance. Padalizi, transit. daddalizi, a dance. 
Maadaddalizi, a dancer.
zinûmmap, tadûmmàp, dappa, dappen, zinap, inodappen, as chûmmachil.

zinùmmarrab, tadûmmarrab, g: darrabba, I: darraban, zinarraban, ino darranban, to line, or to fix the
lining in a garment. Also to put one garment over another. Also to live in aultery. Padarrab, transit.
the plural of the preceding. Padarrab, transitiv. Hence dardarab, lining.

zinummalpal, tadûmmapal, g. dapûlla, I. dapallan: dapallan baron, baro asiel, rima oenoete idapal,
idapal, inidapal, inoidapal, zinapallan, inodapallan, to run against any thing, as kadoog; padapal, transit.
daddapal, apush, a clash: daddapal o asiel.

zinúmmarram, tadûmmarram, g: darrama, to practice one's self in any thing, is used both for teacher
and learner. Passi. darramen, dsimarran, inodarranmmen, dummarran, tûmmoch o bido, 
to practice one's self in reading; is verbum act: dûmmarram o sisjien o tûmmoch o bido, the children
exercise themselves in reading. Madarram, as maba. Padarram, dûminarram, acho maba. Dûmmarram
meach ta Deos, to practice one's self, or to learn to pray. Daddaram, nom. exercise. Daram, to exercise
one's self, nom. exercise. Taddaram, one who is practised. Daddarran o aiacha,a meeting for prayer. 
Ma adaddarram, one who exercises himself or another.
zìnûmmaraggadaggal, tadûmmaraggadaggal, darraggadaggalla, to stumble.

dsi, tad, imp. dasdissen, to sit, to squat down, as when men sit on their heels. Padasdis, transit. nom.
daddasdis.
zinûminittin, tadûmmittin, g. dittina, to stop half way, not to go out.

dsi, tad, doassa, doassen, dsinoas, inodoassen, is said of liquor when it is too fresh, that people may
make it more sour or more sweet. Padoas, transit. daddoas, dummoas machoch, put some more acid in
it: daddoas. make it sweeter.

tsi, ta, dobdobba, dobdobben, dsinobdob, ma dobdobben, to wake up any one. Padobdob, transit.
Sadobdob, nom. Ma addobdob, one who wakes up another.

zinûmmochol, tadûmmochol, docholla, dochollen, zinochol, ino dochollen, to strike with the fist on the
breast. dadochol, nom.
dsi, tad, didossa, pass. dosdossen, &c. ja to, to tap, or let off liquor. Padodos, transit

zinûmmoelallis, tadûmmoelallis, g: doelalissa, I: doelalissen, zinoelallis, inodoelallissen, to hit people 
slightly, without hurting them.
zi, ta, g: doragcha, I: to flay, chûmmorach, idem.

zinûmmorat, tadûmmorat, g. doratta, I. doratten, zinorat, inodoratten, to relieve. Chûmmorat, idem.
Padorat, transit. dadorat, nom.
zinûmmori, tadûmmori, g: dorria, to deny, to speak against.

(the last o sounded short) zinummoro, tadûmmoro, g: dorro, to go in. Contract, dorro, dsinorro, &c. 
daddoro, nom.
dsi, tad, dosdossa, passi. dosdossen, &c.  ja ta, to trail one feet. Padosdos, transit.
zi, ta, dûppûlla, dûppûllen, dsinûmpûl. inodûppûllen, to set on fire. Paduppul, transit.
nom. arson. Ma adûddûpûl, one who sets on fire..
fire wood.
mead, honey and water.
中文: 草地、蜂蜜和水（奶與蜜之地？？）

釋義: anything to drink out from. From micham, to drink.
chatto, a tabacco pipe.

to deny, as with us, no: but it is only used in connection with another word: as elli mabisse oaseis.
your heart is not true. Elli pa, is so common that nothing can exceed it. and yet i do not know that is 
the real meaning of it (then what about me?????). It seems to signify that some thing is not in 
existence, as elli pa ja adda de assaban o amicien: or that some thing is not in one possession; as ellipa
ja oa bido ina-ai, the first of which I cannot otherwise understand than that "there is no rice in the village
on the north:" and the other "I have not got your book." See in alli.
spittle.
certain small beans.
the hip.
a toad.

a point. From Maggaat. Gûmmaat, gi: ga: gata: gatan: ginaat, to sharpen, to bring any thing to a point. 
to carve. Ginaat, cut. Gagaat, a sharpening. Ma-agagaat, to sharpen. Ma-aggaat, a sharpener.
the penis.
gi, ga, gea, to belch, to eructate. Pagea, transit. nom: gagea, a belching.
water mixed with herbs, with which the women wash the houses.
half.
a word that is used when any thing tears.
a pipe, a vat.
gi, ga, imp. gomila, pass. gomilan, &c. to blow out the gills. Pagomil, transit. gagomil, nom.
a dove. Don o gorrogot, dove cot.
gi, ga, gabgabba, the cutting of paddy, or millet. Rûmmabies, idem. Pagabgab, transit.

gi, ga, gachhacha, pass, gachhachen, &c. Pagachhach, transit. to hoe away the ground from a house
in a sloping direction. Gagachhach, nom.
gi, ga, gagidsia, to tickle active. pagagiesi, transit. Gagidsi, a tickling. Maagagidsi, a tickler.
gi, ga, gagria, the same as gummagissi.

gi, ga, ga-iecha, pass. ga iechan , gina-iech, ino-ga-iechen, to bear, to endure: act. paga-iech, transit.
gagariech, a lengthening, act. Ma-agagaiech, to lengthen, to delay.

gi, ga, gatacha, gatachen, ginatach, inogatachen, pagatach, transit. gatach, nom. to split up large pieces
of wood; but when bamboos are spoken of, pilla is used. It is also used in the cutting up of pumpkins,
melons, plantains, &c.
gi, ga, geocha, to thatch house.

(let the (e) be scarcely heard) gi, ga, gesarra, gesarran, the same as gummiddiggit: gesar, just as if
people said gsar, a gripe, a handfull.

gi, ga, giacho, giachen, giniach, ino-giachen, to fence, or secure; people say also, giûchen ja sabba,
as if the river were suddenly swollen and therefore a fence was made. 
Pagiach, transit. nom. gigiach, a fence.

gi, ga, giacha, giachen, giniach, inogiachen, to stretch out the arms, as lazy people do; as paggeas,
merely, to reach out the arm, leg, finger, &c. neutr. magiach.

gi, ga, giddiggitta, giddiggitten, ginigddiggit, ino-giddiggitten, to close the hand. Also to grasp any thing
fast. nom. gagiddiggit, a fist.
gi, ga, gnabba, gnabben, ginab, ino-gnabben, to begin. As ptat, and pto. Gagnab, nom. as paptat.
small.
gi, ga, gocha, gochen, ginoch, ino-goch, pagoch, transit. Gagoch, nom: to bind together.
the same as gûmmoch

gi, ga, gomacha, gomachen, 
ginummach, inogomachen, 
to rub out any thing that is drawn or written.
Pagomach, transit. gûgomach, nom.
a bambo pole to carry with.

a denial, used only in forbidding, 
as hai magiepe, make no noise.

all kinds of fat man or beast; written Ema.
Hemo tillij, a badger's fat; written Emotillij.
中文:
泛指肥胖的人或野獸
Hemo tillij （獾的脂肪）

釋義: the hip. See Erien.
go.

a particle denoting interrogation, 
ja madûrram jonoe ta Deos o Baûsie, do you know the God of the Dutch?
中文:
表示問句的助詞
例：ja madûrram jonoe ta Deos o Baûsie
（你知道荷蘭的神嗎？）

釋義: why do you give me that.
the roe of fish.

a snake.
*ibien ota, small red snake, makaka.
ibien o aras, korrokorroan, a spotted snake.
ibien abo, a large bellied snake, matoatsi.
ibien baron or isaijs, a snake hard in the back, mattilo, maraas asieg
ibien marali, a snake with large eyes, matoto macha.
ibien e ribij, snakes that creep quietly along the ground, and remain in the granaries.
*ibien o atei, a snake that blows its cheeks up: mato a ri.
*ibien o boesûm korrokorron maûsi, snakes spotted with black and white.
*ibien tagotago de abas, korrokorroan mekach maûsi, mali kach ja ki-or, snakes found in the sea. spotted green and white with broad tails.
中文:
本義：蛇
*ibien ota: 小紅蛇
ibien o aras: 斑紋蛇
ibien abo: 寛腹蛇
ibien baron or isaijs: 硬脊蛇
ibien marali: （可能是）眼鏡蛇
ibien e ribij: 蛇匍匐而入穀倉
*ibien o atei: 蛇鼓起口腔（？）
*ibien o boesûm korrokorron maûsi: 黑白相間的蛇（雨傘節）
*ibien tagotago de abas, korrokorroan mekach maûsi, mali kach ja ki-or: 海蛇（有綠白色斑紋、寬尾）
(*打星號表示蛇很毒XD)

釋義: a hook, like a parrot's bill.
he
the moon, also a month.
a shell, also a spoon; from midod, to lade out.
a fan, a species of mouse.

a mulberry. Baron o iel-iel, the mulberry tree. 
Bo' o iel-iel, the fruit.
中文:
桑葚；Baron o iel-iel 桑葚樹；
Bo' o iel-iel 桑葚果

釋義: a small fiery pimples.
fear; from mikkil, afraid.

inimigh-igh, amigh-igh, g: igh-igha: l: igh-ighen, migh-igh, inoigh-ighen,
to gnaw, to nibble. Imighigh o ûso, to bite the nails.
ye.
all kinds of herbs that spring out of the ground; weeds.

I, mine, it serves also to put out every kind of cause, (except the immediate;)
Ina o elli arioon, pattas o bido, ina papagcha jo, because yo do not write well, I will flog you
中文: 我；也可用在除去所有因素

釋義: because, therefore; perhaps from innaû and innaû numma.

asks every kind of cause, except the immediate. 
Inaûmmima jo pagcha ina, why do you strike me.

who, what, in what place?
indea, the same: also edea.
seems to mean, therein.
a line drawn. From kummir rich, passivum praet.
from a place; as pana, to a place.

whence, from what place.
ka mai jana, innai takais; people also say innai dema
jo mabaddai, whence know you that?
as Innai dema.

in a place: inni Taiwan, in Taiwan. 
inni don, in the house.

betokens the immediate cause.
ino airien o arrar, in order to make a railing.
why, where for? this asks after the immediate cause.
中文: 為什麼？（用於某事發生之後）

釋義: all kinds of food.
here.
ye, you.
a chicken; also  kuki-jirm.
the will. From merab.

i, inisa, a-isa, imp. passi, isasan, inisa, inoisasan, to imitate.
Paisasa, transit. isas, nom. a likeness.

inisabhesab, ino-isabbesab, struck down.
lsabbesab ita, beat down to the ground; as millet or rice in the field.
a sand hill
a sack made of bulrushes, a purse.
a rat.
certain sure; written gagil.
rich, affluent.
a fisherman's net. From kúmmir.
a swallow.
in order that, perhaps not, asdopa.

the left. Ma kairi, verbum. 
Kair‘i a rima, left hand. Kairi a tea, the left arm.
Kairi o magcha, the left eye.
the womb.
red. Verb. Makakas.
a razor. From Kummatos.

the right. Kallamas a rima, atea, o, macha, the right hand, arm, or eye.
Verbum Makallamas.
see dalli.
a line, or long stripe; see chachirrich, in Ch.
a great pot
covetousness; see Magamgam.
also  kamossi, a field rat.

kaminachaggi, kamamachaggi, to know certainly.
Kamachaggi o maba, idem.
 Merien o chagchi, to do anything to purpose.
a he goat.

makes the superlative degree,
as kûmmasies a mata, mario, the greatest, best.
a muscle.
a chizel. From kûmmabesach.
disobedience, transgression. From kúmmogi.
compounded with nouns, signify the same as mau, when compounded with nouns or verbs.
中文: 連接名詞詞組或動詞詞組中間的繫詞

釋義: karri-ada, to share: idem mausada.

kinarri-apiech, ka karrì-apiech, karrì-sapiecha,
to fight with each other: id mau-apiech.

karri-atita, to speak together or to converse.
idem karrì-ala, and mau-ala, to tell each other.

to cast lots. In the change of tenses karri, is inflected and not babisso.
Ki, ka karri, babissoa, dito maûbabisso.
karrisasopatta, to stand over against each other.
wrath, anger: from makarricho.
see maûsasakimotto.

a piece of anything. 
Differs from bitil: and is said of fish or flesh.
Kattach o arierfi, o bilpìl, o abì, o baaf, written gatach, see gûmmatach.

to throw before each other.
Kinartattis hakartattis,im. karraìtìsa.
kariau, aûnisa, belonging to each other.
to pay visits backwards and forwards: id. mautattubboel.
karri auana, to eat together, to give food to each other.

aan a tammas, or harri or man, aan, o rarozì, is the manner of the natives. when they will make a treaty
of peace with each other; they pluck a thread out of each other's clothes and eat it up; which is a sign
of peace: this contract is made midway between their villages.
中文:
為該族的習俗。
語其他部落的居民訂定和平契約時，會扯下對方衣服上的一根草吃掉。
此舉為和平的象徵。

釋義: a hoe.
a reap hook, or scythe. From Kûmmaûr.
a branch of paddy stalk.
a notch; see mokibach, notched.
an earth warm
a rent. From makikiet.
a tail.
fine, adorned, as mauchus, malle.
as kole-akis.
a bridge, a ladder.
a flute, blown through the nose.
a word of strong denial, as no, by no means. Sometimes also Koa, Ko-ai.
few, small of itself; smaller than many is ma-jed. Written kotsi.
a cuckoo
hard of hearing, deaf
a hen bird.
a cock.
a hen.
kole a kis, a yellow finch.
a frog. Goliggo, takeis
party coloured.
very much variegated.
certain small ???

kinumbor, kakumbor, g. koborra, I koborren. Kinebor, ino-koborren,
to draw water, to lade.
kaarchabba, to break wind: ka kaarchab,, foul wind.

ki, ka, k‚abacba, kabachen, kina bach, inokabachen, pakabach, trans. nom. ka kabach,
a sort of binding from under the bottom.

kinummaat, kakummaat, g. kaatta, l: kaattan, kinaattan, ino’kaattan, to clip, to cut.
written gûmmaat, Kummaat o chaar, to make a pen.

kablierra, kaberren, kinabber, ino-kabberren. Pakabber.
Also a kind of binding, as kûmmabach. 
Kakabber, nom. such kind of binding. Ma akakabber, a binder.

kinûmmados, kakûmmados, g: kadossa, I: kadossen, kinados, inokadossen,
to take in the arms.

kinummaggimo, kakummaggimo, g: kooggimoa, kooggimoon. kinaggimo, ino-kooggimoon,
to bring to confusion. Written gûmaggimo.

kaihacha, kaibachen, kinaibach, ino-kaiûachen, to put in a sling.
Pakûibach, to do so. Kakaibach, a sling.
kinum maizizi, kakūmmaizizi, kaizizia, to do anything softly.
kallabeian, kinallabeian, ino-kallabeian; as kummabach.

kinûmmalossikos, kakummalossikos, kalossikossa, I: kalossikossen, 
kinalossikos, ino-kalossikossen, to uncover, to discover.

kalossikotta, kalossikotten, kinalossikot, inokalossikotten, to curl, act. 
pakalossikot, trans.
kakalossikot, nom. a curling, a curl.

kinämmai, kakūmmai. g. kaia,
I: kai-in, kinai, ino-kai-in, to carry on the back. Written gummai.

kinummallobos, kakūmmallobos, g: kallobossoa, 
I. kallobossen, kinallobos, inokaliobossen, to fold any thing up, as tobacco, money, &c. in paper.

kinum mammo, kakummammo, g: kammoa, I: ikanimo, inikammo, inoikammo, 
to fold the arms lazily.

kapiera, pas, kapieren, kinapier, ino-kapieren, to hook on.
Pakapier, trans.kakapier, a hooking on.

kinummapos, kakūmmapos, g: kapossa, kapossan, & kinapos, kinapossan, 
inokap ossan, to stop up. Kammapos, o kallaman, to close a pot:
kûmmapos, o tarran, to stop up a road.
Kakopos, the stopping of an action.
Ma akakapos, to stop up.

kinûmmaram, kakummara,
g: karama, I: karaman, and kinarram,
kinarraman, inokarraman, to rake together.

kinämmargar, kakömmargar, kargarra, kargûrran, kinargarran,inogargarran, 
when a house is in danger of being blown down by the wind to fasten it to a pole stuck in the ground. 
Also a vessel lying at anchor. 
Written gûmmargar, gagargar, nom. an anchoring, a cable. Gagargaran aijan, an anchorage. a roadstead.
中文:
把房子固定在地上的柱子上；
船隻停泊

釋義:
kinämmartúppo, kakūmmartúppo, g: kartúppoa, to dive underwater. 
Kakartúppo, a ducking. Maakartuppo, a diver.

kinummarummokummo, kakūmmarummokummo, g.
karummokummoa, I: karūmmokūmmoon, 
kinarummokummoon, ino-karummokammoon, to wrinkle together.

to roll. Kiilummarinikini, kinum marrinikini, kakūmmarrinikini,
g. karrinikinia, l: karrinikinien, kinarinikinien, inokarrinikinien,
to make round like a ball, to roll up, activ.
written gåmmarini.

impe. kasa, to dream.
Pakasa, transit. kasa, nom. a dream.
Minit o nûa kasa, I saw in my dream.

kinûmmaskas, kakûmmaskas, kaskassa, I: kaskassen, kinaskas,
imokaskassen, to scrape. l. gimmasgas, gagasgas.

kinummatos, kakūmmatos, g: katossa, I: katossan, kinatossan,
inokatossan, to scrape the beard.

kinummattir, kakummattir, g: katirra, I: katirren, kinattir, inokattirren, 
to bind with a long cord, as a fence, and the roofs of houses are bound.

kinummatto, kakummatte, g: kattoa, I: kattoon, kinatton, ino-kattoon, to draw, to pull to one's self.
Pakatto, transit. kakatto, nom: people say, kūmmatto no morabbies, the ebb begins to draw.

kinûmmaar, kakûmmaar, g: kaura, I: kańron, kinaar, inokańron, to reap, to mow. 
Kaur, nom. a scythe, a reap hook.

kinum melokkolo, kakummelokkolo, g: kolokkoloa, I: kolokkoloan, kinolokkoloan, inokolokkoloan, 
to jump over any place.
kûmga, kinumga, kinûmûch, &c. to close the sleeve of a coat.

kerisa, pass: kerises, kirieries, inokerises, to lay the head on one side, to take aim. 
Pakeries, transit. kakeries, nom.
中文: 把投靠在一邊；下定目標

釋義:
kinûmmenis, kakummenis, kinissa, kinissen, kininis, inokinissen,
to appropriate what was common by division, or to tear any thing in two. 
Written gåmmenees.

kinûmmeriel, kakûmmeriel, g: kriella, I: kriellan, kiniriellan, ino-kriellan, to listen sharply. 
Kakriel, a listening. Ma-akakriel, a listener.

kinûmmeroa, kakûmmeroa, g. keroa, or eroa, I: keroan, or eroan,
kineroa, or ineroa, ino-keroan, or inoercan, to divide in two; 
written gûmmeroa, gageroa, such division.
*The inflections come from peroa, see in P.
kinummi, kakûmmi, g: kia, l: kian, kinian, inokian, inikkan, to look behind.

kinûmmibokibo, kakûmmibokibo, g: kibokiboa,
I: kibokiboon, kinibokibo, ino-kibokiboon, 
to disturb, as by quarrelling. Pakiboki
bo, transit. kakibokibo, nom.

kinummikiet, kakummikiet,
g. kiekiedda, I. kikiedden, kinikiet,
inokikiedden, to tear any thing in pieces. Pakikied, trans, kakikied, a rip.

kinûmmirigh, kakûmmirigh, g. kierga, 
I: kiergan, kimirgan,inokirgan, to draw a line on paper or wood, 
&c. Kakirmich, a line, a ruler.
中文: 畫一條直線在紙或木片上

釋義:
kinkinna, kinkinnen, kininken, inokinkinnen, 
to click as with small bells. 
Pakinkin, transi. kakinkin, a clinking.

kinummio, kakimmio, ki-o-a,
kioon, kineo, inokioon, to but with the head, as goats, oxen, &c.
中文: to but with the head????像山羊、公牛一樣

釋義:
kiolia, kiollen, kiniol, inokollen, to sharpen at the point;
act. pakiol, trans, kakiol. Ma-akakiel, to point.

kinûmmir, kakûmmir, g: kirra, I: kirren, kinir, inokirren, 
to fish with a net called kagir, l: gummir, nom: gagir, a net, also fishing.

kinummirgir, kakûmmirgir, g: kirgirra, I; kirgirren, kinirgir, inokirgirren, 
to erase, to cancel. See gûmmirgir, nom, gagirgir, an erasion, a cancelling.

kirkira, kirkirren, kinirkir, inokikirrren, 
to gnash with the teeth; act, pakirkir, trans, kākirgir, a gnashing. Mla-akakirkir, to gnash.

kinummirragh, kakummirragh, g; kirragcha, I:kirragch en, kirrirragch, inokirragchen, 
to tear to pieces.
g; kirra, kirragcha, see kūmmirragh.

kintiminissikissiel kakûmmissikissiel, g: kissikissilla
slowly, to do anything quietly, whether walking, eating, working, &c.
中文: 緩慢；無論走路、吃、工作動作都很輕柔

釋義:
kissokissoa, kissokosoon, inokissokissoon, to move up and down as the tail of an animal.
Mado kūmmissokisso, kior, kissokissot, nom. kakisso, 
is said of the rudder of a ship because it moves backwards and forwards: 
otherwise kakisso, and kakissokisso, the motion itself.

kinummitor, kakūmmitor, g: kittorra, I: kittorren, kinitor, inokitorren, 
to plait any thing as a reed, bamboo, &c.

kitta, kittan, kinitta, inokittan, to stick the foot out behind.
Pakitta, trans. kakitta, a sticking out.
written gummiddiggit.

kinummoagh, kakûmmoagh, g: koageha, l: koagchen, kinoagh, inokoagehen, 
to loose, to unbind, to put off, as clothes. It is also used respecting the mind, 
and means to draw in one's courage. 
Paka-ach, pi, pa, ipako-ach-a, &c. to loose. Kûmmoach obre, to unstring a bow.
中文: 鬆綁、解開；也表示敬重心靈，獲得勇氣

釋義: to chizel, ki, ka, kakoesach, a chisel.

kinummoar, kakûmmoar, g: koarra, I: koarren, 
kino-ar, inoko-arren, to jump over. 
Kakoar, nom. a jump. Maakakoar, to jump.

kinummoen, kakummoen, g: koeaa, l: koenen, kinden, inokoen, 
to imprison, to bind. Kakoen, chains.
Ka koen-an, a prison.

(written gúmmoch) kinûmmoch, kakûmmogh, to bind, 
g: kogcha, I: kogchen, kinogh, inokogchen,
kummogh, o baan i barron, to tie the
horse to a tree, mom. gagoch, a binding.

kinûmmoghkoch, kakûmmoghkoch, g: koghkogeha, I: koghkogchen, 
kinoghkogh, ino-koghkogchen, to wash out.

中文:
只會與 ranied, rima, and riba搭配
表示關閉

釋義: kinûmmokot, kakûmmokot, g: kokotta, to lie bent.

imp. kolotta, passi. kolotten, kinolot, inokolotten, to loathe.
Pakolot, transi, kakolot, a loathing.
kotkotta, to bow, as lummogot.
as kummaibach.

kinummomokummo, kakummokûmmoa, kummokummoon,
kinummokûmmoon, inokummokummoon, to rub the hands one against the other.

kalachkacha, kalachen, kinalachkach, inokalachkachen. Pakalachkach, transi, 
to cut an animal in two, lengthways; the same as simmarabsab.
中文: 將動物剖開切成長條狀

釋義:
kintimmono, kakummono, g: konoa, kono-an, kinoloan, inokonoan, 
to bear, to endure. Kakoeno, patience, endurance. Ma-akakoeno,patient.

(written gûmmorach,) kinummoragh, kakûmmoragh, g: koragcha, l: koragehen, kinorach, 
intend. nom. gagorach, ma-agagorach, a flayer.

kossia, kossian, kinossi, ino-kossen. Pakossi, transi. to disobey. 
act. kakossi, wickedness, disobedience. 
Ma-akakossi, a wicked fellow. 
Pakossi, pi, pa, pakossia, ipakossi-in, inipakossi, inopakossi, to disobey.

kinûmpi, kakûmpi, g: kupia, I: kuppien, kinuppi, inokuppien, 
to fold up, to roll up, to pack together in a box.

kāmkämma, to lay hold of with all the fingers at once.
Pakuˋmkuˋm, transit. kakûmkûm, nom.
karra, to open, to unfold the hands only: kûmrar o rimai.
any thing folded or rolled up, a bundle. Küppio zikakas, a roll of silk, Kûppi o bazigh, a roll of deer skins.
中文: 折起來或捲起來的東西，捆

釋義: to crawl: used only of plants and vegetables.

kinſmzijr, kakûmzijr, g: kizijrra, I: kizirren, kienzijr, inokizijrren, to nip, to pinch, to pick, to pluck.
People say also, kumzijr o to-i, draw out a splinter. Kakezijr, a nip.
a pan, a shovel. From Palablab.
added to ta, means fruitful; joined to baron, it means weak, unable to work. Malabo, the verb.
bruised rice.
a green leek.
pap made from rice and water.

a fine yellow kind of bark, which people use, and sometimes insert for ornament: as their spears are wound round with red rattan and this bark alternately; the natives also weave the same split very fine, here and there, in their own coats, for ornament.
中文: 一種黃色的樹皮，人們用來作矛、編織、衣服上的裝飾

釋義: a wooden stand, for a light. From Lûmmatagh.
and lalian azijhja, midday.
in, within. Molalitim, in, deep. Paolallum, transi. to make any thing deep, to dig deep.
the dew; verb. malamo, to bedew; bedewed, or damp.
an out house, where people keep all kinds of implements, rice, &c.
an out house; where people keep fish or flesh. Compounded of la-ob, and momas.
the lightning. From Lumka.
a cushion.
a comb.
the eyelashes.
I: linenesoleso, lalenesoleso, lenesolesoa, to shout after the native manner, when the women have concluded a dance or song.
中文:
一種傳統習俗
女人舞蹈結束後歡呼、喊叫

釋義: meaning, interpretation, explanation, li, la, lidoa. Palido, transit. Lido, opinion, meaning.
tin
linimmichob, lalinimmichob, lichobba, lichobben, linichob, inoli. chobben, to sip.
li, la, labitta, labitten, linabit, inolabitten, to pinch between two; but to press underneath is summelit; it means also to press against another.

linimiod, lalimiod, liodda, liodden, liniod, inoliodden, to wring
once round, to give one turn.
to lighten, to blink with the eyelids.
a horse, cow, buffalo, &c. also a servant, a slave. In this last sense the word is used in contempt or in anger.
中文: 馬、牛、水牛；也意為奴隸（用於輕視或怒罵時）

釋義: as roos, a shore.

to induce, to incite to evil. Also to haunt.
Palala, to tempt; lalala, a temptation, a ghost.
to threaten by word or action.
a little sick, in disposed.
to kneed, to press down

linummapilapies, lalûmmapilapies, lapilapiessa, &c. the same
as lûmmapies, lallapilapies.
to redeem any one from punishment, with money.
to set on a stand.
to court, in order to marriage.
to make burn brighter or clearer. Also to cook or boil anything by a clear fire.
中文: 將火燃得很旺；也指用火煮

釋義: to open, as the eyes.
to draw in one's belly.

to deny;
lallido, a denial.
to glow, also to look angry.
to totter, to wave; is only used concerning great things, as trees, bamboos
中文: 搖搖欲墜（只能用來形容巨大的事物，如樹、竹）

釋義: to run after, to hunt.
to accompany.
to steal.
to give out rope.
li, la, logotta, logotten, linogot, inologotten, to vow; as kûmmotkot.
linûmmokogh, lalûmmokogh, lokogcha, lokogchen, linokogh,inolokogchem, to comb.
to drive together from all sides; is used of animals, as deer, goats
to look wantonly.
to touch, also to trifle, to pass away the time.

li, la, loomma, passi. loommen, limoon, ino-loommen, seems to mean, to arrange any thing with the acknowledgement of a previous benefit; as làmmoon oatite, oramied. Lalloom, nom. Whenever any one will acknowledge that another has done a service for him, he presents something of what he has acquired to him who procured it for him; which people call Lûmmoon oatite.
中文: 對過去受惠的事心存感恩地安排下一件事情

釋義: to dig any thing up that was buried, also to bring up old things long since done.
中文: 挖出，或提起過去的事情

釋義: to twinkle as the fixed stars, to blink.
a disswader: kannaddo.
a wise man. From maba. Maaijaab, a prophet. From Me-aab.
a messenger, one who brings tidings.
a transporter.
fruitful, used generally of plants, animals, or men.
中文: 多產的（通常用在植物、動物或人）

釋義: fruitful; said of beasts.
a murderer.
a thief.
one who understands cooking, a cook.
a rewarder of good or evil.
stubborn, disobedient.
vinegar
a sharp sighted man.
a giver
a disobedient ring-leader of rebellion.
fruitful, said of the ground.

kind, benevolent. Dan minaallal mamallaal a-allalla, a-lalal-len,
ina-alallen, ino a-alallen. Al-al, bland.
frightened, appalled.
a measurer.
a theif
one who makes drunk.
one who receives or obtains much.
a priestess
unemployed, one who has nothing to do. Also at peace, and undisturbed. g: a-arra.
中文: 無業遊民；生活清靜、不受打擾

釋義: a sinner, a villain.
one who can sing well in company.
中文: 能配合辦奏唱得很好的人

釋義: cold; as masûmah.
a watchman. From ûmi.
a sort of fish, like the cod.

activ. fond of distinction, shame-faced, to carry oneself modestly towards another whom men honour. Aärichag. Paarich, to honour any one; or to be ashamed before any one,
a-arich, honour, a sense of shame. Ma-aarich, one who honours another, or conducts himself modestly.

to catch, as chūmmaü: also a certain mode of fishing with a net, to catch shrimps, called audn.
Aas, a besom, but only such as are made of a certain plant called alsoaas; otherwise it is chachań.
中文: 抓，一種用網捕魚、蝦的技巧

釋義: an envier.
one who sleeps much,a sluggard.
a fifer, one who plays well on a flute.
eight
a sluggard.
eight by eight.
a crier.
a smith.
a tailer.
a giver
useless through indolence, worthless.
one who has a good memory. From tumpa.
poisonous; fr. Sumbach.
a forerunner.
a comforter

is used only of the swelling of rivers, not occasioned by the sea ortide: proût, mi, fut, ma; transi. paat; nomen ańt. Mabarrija ačt o sabba, the fresh of the river is very strong, or the stream is strong, Aataijan, the lower part of a river where the running out of the water makes the river greater and stronger.

mi, ma, aata, is used for fire wood;
thus they say; maat-eeb, to cut fire wood: trans, paat. pi. pa. ipaata.

or ma-atattose, a liar.
From tummosik, from tûmmose.
a predecessor in any thing.

one who speaks openly to the people, a preacher. Ma-atil, a minister.
From pattite, from patil,
a Doctor. From Pataûso.
one who is always drowsy: from moba.
forgetful: from poach.
a man or woman, who deserts his or her partner: from moriedda.
中文: 拋棄了他的伴侶的男人或女人

釋義: one who sets any thing on fire: from ponnadi or monad.
a widow or widower:
one who hides any thing in play.

minaba, mamaba, to know, to understand; ma bada saan, and zies, an understanding heart, g: maba, seems also to mean, to acknowledge. Maabam charsar ja ta Labba; I know Labba's voice. Pala, transi. Aba, knowledge, science. Ma-aba, a wise man. Intendit. mababa; nom. ababa; abako taposai, omniscient.

minabaas, mamabaas, abasa, abasem, inabaas, ino-abasen, to creep. Pabaas, trans, to crawl: mabaas morab is very fine weather; malaas mariollo, when the beasts eat grass: when it is foul and rainy weather, and the beasts lie in the grass: nom. abaas, a creeping. Ma-abaas, a creeper.

minababat, mamababat, ababadda, the gait of men and beasts. Also the moving onwards of any thing that moves locally. Pababat, transit. imp, ababadda, ipababadda. Ababad, a path, a way. Pass. ababadbad, iniden, inababad, inoababadden, ipabapababad, inoiapabad. Ababadden iata, the ground is trodden.
中文: 人或動物的步伐；也指走向接近的東西

釋義: an old man, one who is getting old.

mi, ma, abachasa, to be dry; bachas, drought. Pabachas, to dry; activ. imp. ipabachasa, transi. passi. abachassen, activ. obachassen, inobachas, inoabachasen, ipabachas, inipabachas, inoipabachas; people say in short, mabas en palas. Ma-abachas, dryness, drought.
unbent. From pabach-ich, mi, ma, an unbending, a diversion. Ma-abachchich, one who diverts.
mi, ma, same as mamacho.
to look hard, to stare.

mi, ma, abadda, abadden, inabaddan, inoabaddam, the running of the paper in writing. Mabad o barritok. 
Differs from momach. Pabad, trans. abad, a flowing.

mi, ma, oballa, o ballaan, inoballa, ino-oballaan, to leak; differs from misosso; maballa, when the hole is large and it leaks much, and misosso, when the hole is smaller and it leaks a little. Patiballa, transi.

to be strong; g; abarra, mi,ma, barra, strength. From Mabarra. Ma-abarra, a strengthener. Pabarra, trans. ipabarra, et activ. imp. abarra. Pass. ipabarra,inipabarra, inoipabarra, acti, abarran, inabarra, inoabarran.

minabarras, mamabarras, abarrassa, abarrassen, inabaraas, inoabarrasen, to proceed against the enemy, in order to fall on him by surprise. Pabarras, ipabarrassa, imp. trms. nom. abarras, a going forth against the foe. Ma abaras, to go forth.
ma, abarranna, neutr. not naked; pabarran, act. et trans.
minabarri, mamabarri, abarria, to blow; pabarri, transi. abarria, ipabarria, imp. to blow. Pas. barrin, binarrin, ino-barrin, trans. ipabarri, inipabar-ri, inoipabarri. Barri, nomen. the wind.
mi, ma, like maries.

scented; mi, ma, abassoa, also well tasted, neutr. is said of salmon. which smells or tastes well. Basso, nom. taste or smell. Pabasso, smelling good, to make tasty; imp. act. abassoa, trans. pabassoa, pas. bassoan, binassoan, inobassoan, pabasso, inipabasso, inoipûbasso.
(the o short) to taste well, activ. mi, ma, imp. achopulla, pass. achopullen, inochopul, inchopullen a taster, one who prepares the food.
mi, ma, imp. abauasa, a dangling in play after which they shout.
中文: a dangling in play after which they shout

釋義: mi, ma, abazibadda, just, even; mapospos, contrarium, mi, ma, apospossa, papospos, transi. pospos, nom. Pabazibat, pi, pa, ipabazibadda, transi. act. abazibadda, nom. bazibad. Pass. act. bazibadden, binazibad, inobazibadden, trans. ipazibad, inipazibad.
中文: 正好, 就算 just, even

釋義: (the last a is scarcely heard,) minabagh, mamûbagh, abûgcha, abagchen, inabagh, inoabagchen, to embrace, to take in both arms, also to carry on the arms. Pa-bag, transit.
中文: 擁抱, 用雙手拿, 拿在手上

釋義: mi, ma, abidoa, to be black. Pabido, transi. and imp. ipabidoa, ipabido, inipabido, inoipabid, acti.abidoa, passi. abidoan, inabidoan, ino-abidoan.
mi, ma, abilloa, neutr. cloven. Pabilla, act. and trans. Billa, a cleft. Maabilla, cleft.

mi, ma, abillaga, pabillaag, to enlarge, nom. billaag, breadth. Maabillaag, trans. en acti. one who enlarges. imp. abillaga, pas. abillagen, inabillaag, inoabillagen, ipabillaga, ipabillaag, inipabillaag, inoipabillaag. Mabillabillaak, flat.

mi, ma, abinnassa, healthy. Pabinnas, trans. to heal. transi. et act. impr. abinnassa, ipabinnassa, pas. a binnassen, inabinnas, inoabinasa, i. pabinassa, ipabinnas, inipabinas, inopa-binnas. Binnas, health. Abinnas, a healing. Mabinnas, a restorer, a healer.

mi, ma, abinnia, fat, fleshy. Pabinni, to fatten, trans. et acti. imp. abinnia, abinni-in, inabinni, inobinni-in, ipabinnia, pas. ipabinni, inapabinni, ino-ipabinni. Binni, fatness, abinni, a fathom. Maabioni, a fattener.

mimabior, mamabior, abiorra, to remain behind without going forth. Pabior, trans. et act. imp. abiorra, ipa-biorra, pas. inabiorran, inoabiorran, ipabiorra. ipabior, inipabior, inaipabior. Bior, nom. is used as a preposition. Ma-abior, to remain behind.
mi, ma, abirbirra, abirbirren, inabirbir, inoabirbirren, abirbirren, a composing of the mind in anger. Mabirbir itsies, to pacify. Pabirbir, ditto. Abirbir, nom. a composing, a pacifying, a pacifier.
中文: a composing of the mind in anger

釋義: minabissas, mamabissas, abisassa, to make one's self ready, to go any where or do any thing. Perhaps also ready. Pas. pabissas; trans. et act. abissassa, abissassan, inabissas inoabissassen, ipabissassan, pas. ipabissas, inipabissas, inoipabissas. Abissas. nom. preparing. Maabissas, a preparer.
中文: 準備好、去任何地方、去做任何事

釋義: mi, ma, abissa, upright in mind, virtuous. Pabissen, trans. et act. imp. abissea, abissei, inabisse, inoabissein, ipabissea, pas. ipabissi, inipabisse, inoipabissen. Ma-abisse, to make righteous. Babisse, righteousness.
as mabise; bisse, is only said of many. ja mabisse bisse tape ja tatakorroe, as straight as a line; intend. mabisse. Bisse bisse, intend. babisse, see pisse. Ma-abisse bisse, to make right, upright.

minabo, mamobo, aboa, aboan, inaboan, ino-aboan, to pity, to forgive, to deliver. Pabo, pinabo, papabo, ipaboa, ipabo, inipabo, inoipabo, ditt?. Anything done out of compassion. abo, iniabo, ino jabo, Abo, nom??? forgiveness, abonno babossi. Bo, grace, mercy; bo no tsies. Ma abo, one who pities.
mi, ma, ab-oa, neutr. to rot: pas. rotten. Pab-o, trans. ab-o, a rotting.
minaboas, mamaboas, aboasa, to remove. Paboas, trans. pass. aboasas, inaboasas, inoaboasas, ja, ta, i-aboas, ini-aboas, ino0iaboas ja ballag; nom. aboas, a removal. Ma-abaas, a remover.
minaboch-o, mamabogh-o, to stink. Paboch-o, trans. et acti. imp. aboch-on, pas. aboch-oan, ipaboch-oa, ipaboch-o, inaboch-oan, inoaboch-oan, inipaboch-o, ino-ipabocho. Bocho, stink.

miniaborra, mamaborra, aborra, to be pacified, neutr. Borra, an ally, from maborra. Ma-aborra, a peace maker. Aborra, pacifying. Paborra, trans. et act. imp. aborra, ipaborra, to pacify.The pas. act. trans. aborran,inaborra, ino-aborran, ipaborra, inipaborra, inoipaborra.
mi, ma aborrieda, neutr. overturned; the root, porried.

raised, bumpy, angular, not round. Maborroch a sies, maborrogh a torran, maborroch ja morra &c. Paborrogh. trans. et act. imp. aborrogga, ipaborrogga, pas. aborroggen, inaborrogh, inoaborroghen. ipaborroggen, inipaborrogh, ino ipaborroghen, Borroch, a bump.
中文: 凸起的、顛簸的、有角的、非圓滑的

釋義: mi, ma, abosoa, neutr. to wear away, to change. Paboso, pi, pa, imp. abosoa, pass. abosoan, inobosoan, ipabosoa, inipaboso, inoipaboso, to wear off.

dead. Cho macha, a dead man; also, dried up. Macha da baron, dry wood. Macha da ta, dry land. Pacha, to kill, acti. imp. acha, achar, inûcha, ino achan, trans. ipacha, inipacha, inoipacha. The neutr. has no other noun than macha itself. It is also the verb macha, mi, ma, acha, to die. Acha, a death blow; nom. Ma-acha, a murderer.
to flow through.
as machio-a-oogh.
an adulterer or adulteress. From chûmmod.
minachab, mamachab, achabba, achabban, inachabban, inoachabban, to do any thing secretly. Pachab, transi. Achab, theft. Ma achab. a thief.

near, not far, mi, ma, achaddikka: neutr. paehaddik, trans. et acti. nom. chaddik, is used as the preposition prope. Radix chûmmaddik. Maûbe a chaddik, to look near. Ma-achaddik ocho, a neighbour, one who is near.

mi, ma, achalloa, clear; machallo a to, clear water: machallo a boesûm, clear air: machallo a tattorrodauron, a clear mirror. Pachallo, trans. et activ. Gallo, nom. clearness. Machallochallo, intend. Ma-achallo, clearer. Pachallo, act. achalloa. pas. ipachalloa, trans. achalloon, inachalloon, inoachalloon, ipachallo, inipachallo, inoipachallo.

the end, mi, ma, achal-pod-da, to come to the last, completed as machil. Achalta, or achalpodda dûmmoro tapos, come in together. Minachalt, or minachal-pod sohsa tapos, they are all gone in together. Pachalt, is acti. et. Pachalpod, trans. finished. Achalta, achalten, inachalt, inoachalten, imp. pas. Pachalta, ipachalt, inipachalt, inoipachalt.
deep. Machammochammo-nochaûch, spoken of a well. Mina, mama, achammochammoa, any thing dark and dismal as in a well. Mamarorammo, is used also by the Takey people Chammochammo ai? morammo, nom.
mi, machanacha, nertr.? notched. See chûmmanach. Chanag, a notch in an arrow.

mi, ma, g: achaporra, of few words, not to speak much, to be sti? Pachabor, transi. et acti. Machapochapor, intend. Chapor, nom. silence. ? is chapachapor. Ma achapor, one which keeps silence: imp. ahaporra, ?, inachaporran, inoachaporra, ipachaporra, pas. ipachapor.

pitted, rumpled, rough. Pachauch, trans. et acti. imp. achaûcha, achaûchen, inachaûch, ipachaûcha, pas. ipachauchen, inipachauch, inoachauchen, inoipachauch. Chaûch, a well. Ma achauch, a well digger.
glowing, metaphorically used of ardent spirits; because th? make the face to glow. Pagappo, glow. acti. trans. imp. apappoa, agpoan, inagappoan, inoagappoan, ino ipagappo.
mi, ma, acharapoa, neutr. chûmmarappo.
mi, ma, acharriebba, invisible, is used of wind, spirit, &c. Acharrieb, nom. Ma acharrieb, one who renders any thing invisible.
mi, ma, achattoa, to smoke. Pachatto, acti. trans. imp. achattoa, achattoan, inachattoa, inoachattoan, ipachattoa, pas. ipachatto, inipachattoa, inoipachattoa. Chatto, nom.
mi, ma, imp. achea, pass. acheën, inache, inoacheën, to guess whether any thing is even or uneven.

minacheaubon, mamachaeaûbon, pas. acheaubonnan, inacheaûbonnan, inoachaûbonnan. Acheaubonnan, to jest, to joke, to sit idle, to dally. Acheûabon, nom. dallying. Ma acheaubon, to trifle. Ta ja don acheaubonnan, the place where people play.
中文: 開玩笑、戲耍、空閒地坐著

釋義: sweet: mi, ma, achedoa, (the e short) chedó, sweet. Ma achedo, a sweetener. Pachedo, transi.
ingenious, mi, ma, acheer. Pacheer, trans. et act. pi, pa, imp. achera, acheran, inacheran, inoacheran, ipachera, pas. ipacheer, inipacheer, inoipacheer. Cheer, wit.
intend. machedacheda; mi, ma. acheda, pas. achedaûn, & c. to change one's word or will. Pacheda, trans. Cheda, changeableness.
an elder brother or sister: eousin or nephew.
minachia, mamachia, achia, to repent, to change one's mind. Pachia, transit. to change any one. Achia, repentance. Ma achia, one who exhorts to repentance.

mi, ma to drivel: achi achi erab, or machi achi, mi, ma, achi a chia, this is also to leak; nom. achi a ch, and achi a chi erab, slaver. Ma achi achi, one who drivels. Pachia chi erab, and pachi a chi, transi. Ma chiagchi, composed from machiagchi, to leak, and erab, spittle. Machiagchi ohallaonan, the pot leaks. Achiagchi in, inachiagchi in, ina achisgchi in ja to, the water is leaked out.
minachiegh, mamachiegh, neutr. to roast; achiecha, to broil, trans. Pachiech, to boil, the root is chummiegh, see the nomina; activ. siet P.
mi, ma, achigilla, nearly like medadorri, Takeijs. Chiegh, a roasting. Ma achiegh, a roaster, as ma achachieg. Chieg, roast. Ma achieg, any thing roasted

mi, ma, achimta, spruce, neat, clean, avoiding filth. Pachimit, trans. et act. imp. achimta, achimten, inachimtin, inoachimtin, ipachimta,pass. ipaehimt, inipachimt, inoipachimt. Machimchimit, idem. Ma achimit, a clearer. Chimit, nom. subst. cleanliness, neatness; used also as an adverb.
sour, mi, ma, achich-a. Pachich, trans. et act. imp. achichos, achich in, inachich in, ino achich in, ipachich a, pas. ipachich, inipachich, ino ipachich. Chich, sourish.
minachio-a-oagh, mamachio-a-oagh, a returning.
mi, ma, mamagcho, ipagchoa, ipagcha. inipagcho, inoipagcho, to speak.

rumpled, rough; mi, ma, pachobot, transi. et acti. Machobochobo intend. Chobor, a ruffler. Ma achobor, one who makes ruffles. Imp. achobotta, pas. achobottan, inachobottan, inoachobottan, ipachobattu, pas. ipachobot, inipachobot, inipachobat.
mi, ma, achobbechobba, neutr. i. chummobbechob, to be hasty. Chobbechob, act. et trans. Chobbechob, nom. hasty.

mi, ma, achomorraja, frightened, confounded. Pachomorraja, trans. et act. Achomorraja, confusion,. Ma achomorraha, fright, imp. act. achomorraja, achimorraja, inachomorraian, tran. ipachomorraja, pas. ipachomorraja, inipachomorraia, inoachomorraia, ino ipachomorraia.
minacho, mamacho, achoa, achon, inachon, ino achon, to take elsewhere; but this word in construction with nouns takes (n,) as machon o bido.
everlasting. Pachonsar, trans. Machonsar, one who perpetuates. Acho, nom. ma acho, one who causes continuance.
mi, ma, achochonna, neutr. ploughed. See chûmmûchon, nom. chonchon, a ploughman.

mimachonagh, mamachonagh, achonagh=cha, to haunt. Pachonagh, trans. Achonagh, haunted. Ma achonagh, a haunter. Pachonagh, act. achonagcha, inachonagh, trans. ipachonagcha, pas. ipachonagh, inipachonagh, inoipacho-nagh.

mi, ma, achorapa, neutr. the same as pedara. Pacheraap, trans. achoraap, nom. as aidarra. Pachoraap, act. trans. imp. achorapa, achrapen, inachoraap, ipachorapa, pas. ipachoraap, inipachoraap, ino achorap, ino-ipachorap.

minachote, manachote; acho-tea, averse to any thing that is unpleasant. Also to suffer punishment. The root is chûmmote, see also act. pachote, in p. punishment. Maachote, a sufferer. chote, suffereing.
中文: 對不愉快的事物產生反感、受到懲罰

釋義: mi, ma. achotulla, neutr. bent, not straight, physically and morally. Pachotul, act. et tran. pi, pa, imp. achotulla, ipachotulla, pas. ipachotul, &c. Chotul, a curve.

mi, ma, achúmmachûmma, indistinct, the opposite of marimasal. Chûmmachûmma, nom. Ma achûmmachûmma. Pachûmmachûmma, act. achûmmachûmma, achummachumman, inachummachumman, inoachummachumman, trans. ipachûmmachumma, pas. ipachummachûmma, &c.
minada, mamada, ada, adan, inadan, inoadan,  to divide. Pada, trans. Ada, a share. Ma ada, a sharer.

minadaap, mamadaap, adapa, dadpen, inadap, ino-adapen,  to make haste. Padaap, imp. ipadaba, trans. ada aba, acti. Pass. ada aben, inadaab, inoadaaben, padaab, inipadaab, inoipadaab, adaab, haste. Ma adaab, one who hastens another.
mi, ma, ada-alla, neutr. dishonourable, shameless. Pa-da-al, act. et trans. da-al, nom.

to be satisfied, mi, ma, adabbia. Padabbi, trans. satisfied, dabbi, satiety. Ma adabbi, a satisfier. Adabbi, satisfying, act. Padabbi, act. adabbia, adabbin, trans. ipadabbia, pas. ipadabbi, inipadabbi, ino adabbien, inoipadabbi.
ininadaddo, mamadaddo; adaddoa, to refuse: pas. adadoan, inadadoan, adaddoan. Padad, daddo, a refusal. Ma adaddo, a refuser.

g: mi, ma, adaldalla, gentle, as ma-allal. Padaldal, pa-al-al, trans. Daldal, mildness. Ma-adaldal, one who wishes to be kind. Padaldal, act. adaldalla, adaldallen, inadaldal, paal-al, trans. imp, ipadaldalla, pas. ipa-daldal, inipadaldal, inoadaldallen.

mi, ma, neutr. glistering, shinning, as if well scoured: but this only refers to any thing that has a white ground, and differs from raosan.Dallolees, nom. a shining, it is also the name of a tree, the bark of which shines like the European beech.
minadarram, mamadarram, adarrama, darrammen, madarram, inodarrammen, trained; see the root dummarram, and there the neutr. daram, experience. Ma-adarran, one who is trained.
minadas, mamadas, adassa, adassen, inoadassen, to praise. Madadas, also padas, praise. Ma-adas, a praiser.
minaddik, mamaddik, adikka, &c. to forbid. Paddik. Adik, a prohibition. Ma adik, a prohibiter.

mi, ma g: addoborra, busy, encumbered, neutr. Padobor, trans. Ma-adobor, troubled. Adobor, trouble, act. dobbor, care. Padobor, act. adoborra, adoborren, inadobor, trans. imp. padoborra, pas. padobor, &c.

sick, mi, ma, adicha, nom. adject. Ma-adig, a sickness, one who makes sick, Adigh, a sickening. Dich, nom. sickness. Madeadig, intend. nom. Padich, act. adicha, adich, inadich, trans. ipadicha, pas. ipadich, inipadich, inoadichen, inoipadich, &c.
a dog.

mi, ma, g: adiddena, firm, close, fast holding.Madidden o arrar, a strong railing. Adidden ja tataap-oe, hold it dast. Applied to the mind, firm undaunted. Dadden, firm. Pa-didden, trans. Ma adidden, one who makes fast: adidden, a fastening. Pa-didden, act. adiddena, &c. trans. padiddna, pas. ipadidden, &c.
minadirdir, mamadirdir, adirdirra, to tremble. Padirdir, act. et trans. dirdir, nom. a shaking
minado, mamado, adoa, adoan, inadoan, inoadoan,  to cook. Pado, trans. Ado, a cooking. Ma ado, a cook.
minadobdob, mamadobdob; dobdobba, dobdobben, zinobdob, inodobdobben, hurried and in difficulty. Padobdob, trans. See dûmmobdob, to hasten, neutr. nom. dobdob. Ma adobdob, one who hastens another.

minadochallam, mamadochallam, adochallama, the calming and clearing up of wind and weather; also of anger. Padochallam, act. et trans. imp. adochallam, adochallaman. ipadochallama, pas. ipadochallam, inadochellaman, inoadochalleman, inipadochallam, inoipadochallam. Adochallam. Ma adochallam, one who calms people.

Madodevbo-ibo, faint, weak; mi, ma, adodeibo-iboa, lax. Padodeibo-ibo, trans. et act. imp. adodeibo-iboa, adodeibo-iboan, inadodeibo-iboan, &c. pas. ipadodeiboibo, &c. Adodeibo-ibo, faintness. Ma adodeiboibo, one who makes faint.
mi, ma, gareogera, flat, and round like the wheels of a coach. Pagareogeo, tran. et act. nom. gareogeo.
中文: 如馬車輪子般的扁平圓形

釋義: and magagri, mi, ma, both neutr. from chûmmagids and gûmmagri, ticklish.
minaggaga, &c. see magga, to throw after. Maggag o bato, to stone.
the eyes
mi, ma, agaiecha, neutr. from gummaiech, to delay. Aguiech, lateness, used adverbially. late. Ma agaiech, a delaying, adject.
mi, ma, agakka, pass. agakken, &c. to call out, as pallieb. Pagak, trans. intend. magagak, agak, nom.

mi, ma, unsettled, changeable: mi, ma, agchitagchitatta, is not said of men's will or words, but refers to things that exist now and then, as magchitagchitat moetas, it rains some times.  Agchitagchitat, changeableness.

minagga, mamagga, agga, the means in order to an end, yaga, miagga, inojagga, the object or aim; agan, inagan, inoaggan, to throw out of the hand. Maggo taggargar, to cast anchor. Paga, trans. Aga, the throwing of projectiles. Ma aga, one skilful in throwing.

Maggo-aan, mi, ma, aggo-ana, compounded of magga, to throw, and ann, food; when tow parties, after having promised their children, previous to the marriage, feed each other. Paggo-an, trans. aggo-aan, nomen. subst.
mi, ma, sharp: agaata, pointed. Maggaat o zinoe, a sharp knife: maggaato raro, a three cornered hat. Maggagaat, intend. from gummaat. Gaat, a point. Ma agaat, any thing pointed.
mi, ma, imp. aggea, tough, sticky, paste made from rice, starch, &c.

mi, ma, aggocha, to annoy by vexation. Maggogh ja na, azijel o mababat, maggoghja, maggogh ja na babiaro machip. Pagoch, trans. goch, vexation. Ma agoch, vexer. Pagoch, act. agocha, &c. trans. ipagocho, &c.
mi, ma. agossa, to fish with a sweep net, bu which the fishes are inclosed. Pagos, transi.

mi, ma to bend any thing on the edge or end, as the edge of a napkin, &c. Also to go slanting upwards, as a way. Pagotarrar, trans. et act. imp. agotarrarra, agotarrarran, ipagotarrarra, pas. ipagotarrar, &c.

Magoûlyk, mi, ma, agoulyka, neutr. to sprain the foot, to wrench. Pagoûlyck, act. et trans. a sprain of the foot. The natives cure this by the leaves of a certain tree, called satik, with which they bind up the limb in order to soften the skin, or to disperse the extravasated blood.
mi, ma, agomacha, neutr. blotted out. See gûmmach.
mi, ma, agoracha, the skin rubbed off; magoragh ja rima, the skin is off my hand. Magar aggorach, intend.
