mimai, mamai, imp. moa, to come. the 3rd person has sai, sanai, sasai, trans. only in the 3rd person, pasai, pi, pa: ipasaya. Mai, is he well? interrogatively.

Mai-acho, all those who are related to us, whether male or female; also step father and mother. Seems to be compounded from the verbs Mai, to come, and macho, to bring; because when the daughters marry, they bring their husbands home to dwell.
alike: mi, ma, imp. aubasa, aibas, nom. likeness. Ma aibas, one who makes alike. Paibas act. et trans. imp. aibasa, aibasan, inaibasan, inoaibasan, ipaibasa, ipaibas, &.

minaibat; mamaibat, aibadda, aibaddan, inaibaddan, ino-aibaddon, to work for another for one's board. as the poor do for a meal. Men say also mikat. Paibar, trans. with respect to the person who is served; aibat, nom. service. Maibat, a servant, a labourer. Pas. aibadden, inaibda, inaibadden, inaibad, inoaibadden, with respect to the hire that is obtained.
mi, ma, small, fine; but it is only said of many, for with regard to few it is keuzi; also than not thick. As makied. Paied, to make small. Ma-a-ied, or makikied, thin, Pa-i-ied, pakikied, trans.

Ma-allas, calm, cleared up; is said of wind and weather, also of the feelings. Pa-allas, act. et trans. imp. a-allassa, a-allassen, ina-allassen, ino-a-allassen, ipallassen, ina-allassen, ino-a-allassen, ipallassa. &c. Allas, nom. calmness, clearness. Ma-a-allas, a soother.

Ma-im-it, makiki, idem. Me-imimit, intend. makilikili, idem. middling, not too much, passable, neither too large nor too small. Is also used as machapor, and machapochapor, and then means moderate in conversation, neigher too still, nor too talkative.
kagmairo, mi, ma, aiman, airoan, airoa, inairoan, ino airoan, to change; as men do the teeth, or bucks the horus. Pairo, trans. nom. airo, a changing. Ma-airo, a changer.
minais, mamais, assa, aisan, inaisaa, inoaisan, to laugh. Pais, transais, a laugh. Ma-ais, a laugher.
Ma-issal, mina-issal mama-issal, a-is-salla, to repeat, as children do before their master. Ma-issal o bido, to say out of book. Ma-issal o sies, to say by heart.

mi, ma, aizia, near, at hand: people say also maizi, aizi, and arri, neighbourhood. Aizi, paizi, act. and trans. amp. aizia, aizian, inaizi, inoaizian, ipaizia, pas. ipaizi, inoipaize. Maaizi, nom. and ma arzi, one who brings near.
mi, ma, akabollan, to be angry, to chide, ace. trans. Pakabol, akabolla, akabollen, pak-bolla, pas. ipakobol, inakobol, inoakobollen, &c. Kobol, anger, wrath. Ma-akabol, angry, wrathful.
minakagh, mamakagh, akacha, akachen, &c. to bite. Pagach, trans. Agach, a bite. Ma agach, a biter.
minagagach, mamagagagh, agagagcha, to itch after, to desire strongly. Magagagagach, intend. magagach. Pagagach, trans. gagach, an itching, a disire. Ma-agagach, one who itches.
Ma-kairi, mi, ma, to do any thing with the left hand; as makairi ja simioch, pattite, &c. Ma annigh, idem. Ma akairi, a left handed man.
Ma-kallamas, mi, ma, to do any thig with the right hand; as makallamas ja simioch, pattite, &c. Ma allamas, do.

to be red; mi, ma, akakama, pakakam, trans. et act. imp. akalanna, ipakakanna, kakan, redness. Ma akakan, a red dauber. Pass. akakanna, inakakannan, ipakakan, inikakannan, inipakakan, inokakannan, &c.

agamgamma, to be covetous. Pass: minagamgam, fut. mamagamgam. Ma agamgam, covetous, a miser. Gamgam, covetousness. Pagamgam, act. trans. imp. agagmgamma, agamgammen, ipagam?amma, pas. ipagamam, inagamgammen,&c.

to be solitary, alone; mi, ma, akammigia. Pakammieg. trans. et act. imp. akammichia, akammichiin, inakammichi, inoakammichi-in, ipakimmichia, pas. ipakimmichi, &c. Kammichi, so itude. Maakammigi, one who is solitary and alone.
mi, ma, to be covetous. (as magamgam) akammocha, imp. Pakammoch, act. trans. imp. akammocha, akammochan, ipakammocha, pas. ipakammoch, inakammo inoakammochan, inipakammioch
mi, ma, akapossa, close, ped up. Also clownish, incapable of understanding. Makapos atsies: kûmmapos. Pakapos, act. et kapos, a closing up. Makapos thing stopped up.

mi, ma, akakossia, disobedient. Pakakossi, pi, pa, kossia, akakossi-in, inakakossi, i?kossia, pas. ipakakossi, inipaka?fut. pass. inoakakossi-in inoipak?si; see act. kummossi, to render one disobedient.
minakaries, mamakaries?riba, to run; written magarieb. garieb, trans. pas. agarieban, rieb, inoagarieban, a circle in ?men run. Ma-agarieb, a runne?
mi, ma, akapiera, nertr. hooked on: kapier, a hook, Mapier, adject. hooked to.

mi, ma, makarrichi, m?karrichi, akarrichia, to quarrel snarl. Pakarrichi, trans imp. i?richia, pass. ipakarrichi, inipa?chi, inoipakarrichi, pass. aka?ipakarrichi, inoakarrichi-in. Ka? a quarrelling. Ma-akarrichi, angry. Mizy, idem.
mi, ma akinkinna, neutr. to ring as little bells; see kûmminkin, nom. kinkin, a little bell.
mi, ma, akarroa, as mausse-lakko. Pakarro, to be idle, act. akarro, nom. Ma-akarro, a lazy fellow. Pass. akarroan, akarroan o tsinoep aarrien, the work is neglected.
mi, ma, akirkirra, neutr. see kûmmirkir, to gnash the teeth. Pakirkir, act et trans. Akirkir, a gnashing of the teeth.

mi, ma, akiolla, as maggaat. Kiol, nom. pointed. Makiol ja oog pama dol, a pointed bamboo, tapering towards the top. Ma-akiol, any thing pointed. Pakiol, trans. et act. to sharpen to a point imp. akiolla. pakiollen, inakiollen, inoakiollen, ipakiolla, &c.
ma, mi, akkassa, akkassen, inakkas, inoakkassen, to revile any one, to accuse, to reproach. Pakkas, trans. Makkas o ma atattosik, to accuse falsely. Akkas, a reviling. Maakkas, a reviler.

proper, just, suitable, sufficient; mi, ma, akkieshappa. Keshap and akkeshap, nom. Ma-akkeshappa, act. et trans. pakkeshap, imp. akkeshappa, akkeshappen, inakkeshappen, inoakkeshappen, ipakeshappa, &c.
minakos, mamakos, akossa, akossen, to scratch, to scrape. Pakos, trans. akos, nom. Ma-akos, an extortioner.
mi, ma, akorilasa, neutr. the same as meroobroob.
minakas, mamakas, aksasaa, aksassan &c. to desire. Paksas aksas, desire. Ma-aksas, one who desires.
Makosûm, to be jet black, mi, ma, akosûmma. Pakosum, paosûm; trans. et act. imp. aosûmma, aosum, inaosûm, ipoasumma, pass. ipaosum, &c. Osum, blackish. Ma-aosum, blackener.

minalabagh, mamalabagh, choosing things equally good, not to know which to take, imp. allabagha. Ma allabagh, act. et trans. Pallabagh, pi, pa, allabagha, allabaghen, ina-al-labaghen, inoallabaghen, ipallabacha, ipallabagh, iaipallabagh, inoipallabagh. But Mabag, mi, ma, abagga, abaggen, inabag, not to know what to choose, to be anxious about a choice. Palag, abag, nom. Ma-abag, one who brings another into anxiety.
mi, ma,alaga, alagen, &c. to catch, to surprise one in sleep, as the natives catch game while asleep, or pierce them with a spear.
minalla, mamalla, alla-a, alla-an, &c. to adorn one's self. Palla, trans. to adorn another. Al-la, ornament. Ma-alla, an adorner.

mi, ma, alachacha, loose, not tied tight, the opposite of madidden.  Falachach, act. et trans. intend. malachalachach, imp. alachacha, ipalachacha, a?chachen, inalachachen, inoalachachen, pas. ipalachach, &c. Lachach, looseness. Ma-alachach, one who makes any thing loose.

minakadik, mamakadik, aladikka, aladikken, inaladik, inoaladikken, to take care, to protect, to rule over. Aladik, nom. a protection, rule, Ma-aladik, a protector, a ruler. Aladik, aijan, a seat of government.
mi, ma, alachabba, long, slow, intend. Malachalagab. Palachab, act et trans. imp. alachabba, alachabben, inalachabben, inoalachabben, ipalachabba, pas. ipalachab, &c. Lachab, laziness, slowness.
a sluggard. alachûlachab, as mûlachab, intend.
and malalpielpi, mi, ma neutr. glittering, from lumpi, and lumpielpi.

minalam, mamalam; alamma, one who fights with missile weapons, alûnna: inalam, ino-alammen, the place where; alammen; inalâmman, inoalamman. Alam, missile weapons, karri alam, to tight on, and maise alam, a fight. Ma-alam, one who is skillful, with missiles. Alam-an aijan, a tield of battle.
minalama, mamalame, alama, alaman, inalama, ino-alaman, to cook pap. Palama, transi. Lallama, pop. Ma-alama, a pap maker.
to be flat, mi, ma, alapama, palapa, trans. et act. imp. alapanna, alapannen inalapannen, ipalapanna, pas. ipalapan, &c. lepan, nemen. Ma-alapan, one who flattens.
mi, ma alapitapsa, knended, pressed down; see lûmmapilapies.
Malatt?, a hammer; written malata
Malaûlaûb, minalaûlaub, mamalaulaub, the sparkling of a flame; hence clear, to burn well. Palaûlaûb, pi, pa, &c. see gûmmaûlaub.
中文: 火光的閃爍、清澈的、燃燒旺盛的

釋義: mi, ma, aliodda, aliodden, inaliod, to blow a whirlwind. Paliod, trans. Aliod, nom, a whirlwind.

Malakkûm, minallakkûm, mamallakkûm, allakkûmma, to turn things upside down. Allakkûm, the turning as of a ruler. Ma-allakkûm, one that does that. Pallakkûm, pi, pa, imp. act. et trans all kkumma, ip llakumma, allakkûmman, inallakkûmman, inoallakkûmman, , pas. ipallakkûm, &c. To turn things over and over, but is only said of such things as nature or art has adapted for tunring over.
mi, ma, alitullitoa, to reel: neutr see lûmmitullito.

mi, ma, alleakka, as machote, neutr. pas. alleakken. inalleak, inoalleakken, act. trans. ipalleuk, inipalleak, inoipalleak. Palleak, to be averse. Alieak, aversion. Ma-alleak, a person who is loathsome.
and mallegallegallich, mi, ma, pallegallich, and pailegalligich, as malachach, and makachakechach, pal. chach, and palach lechach.

Malli-alli, minalli-alii, mumalli-alli, alli-allia, to thrill, to shake, alli-alli, no subst. Ma-alli-alli, a shaker, Pualli, imp. act. trans. alli-allia, a alli-in, inalli-alli-in, ino-alli-alliin, &c.
a cup, can, or dish.

mi, ma, almalla, tender, so_
not tough, neutr. also malbo, mi, m_
albea, (contract from malilbe.) Pa_
be, neutr. et trans. albea, ipalbe_e
lilbe, (the i short) nom. softness._
mel, (the e short) nom. softness, ev_
as m_lum_al. Ma-abummal, a softe_
er. Palummal, act. pi, pa, imp. alû_
malla, alûmmallen, malûmmal, &_
Palummal, trans.

minalod, mamalod, alodda, alo_
dan, inaloddan, inoaloddan, to ea_
Palod, tran. alod, nom. Ma-alod, crier.

minaloog, mamaloog, aloogg_
to swarm, to make a stir. See lûmmoo_

mi, ma, alokógcha, meag_
Palokogh, trans. et act. imp. aloko_
cha, alokogchen, inalokoch, inoa_
kogchen. ipalokogcha, pas. ipalokoc_
&c. malokolokogh, idem. intend. nom_
lokoch, leanness. Ma-alokoch, m_
alokolokoch, one who makes thin.

light, not heavy. 
mi, ma, ûlpo_
, act. et trans. imp. alpoa, alpooalpoan, ipalpoa, pas. ipalpo, &c.
lightness. Ma-alpo, a lightnen-
_burthen. Alpo, a lightening.

mi, ma, same as mabadas, by
_ is expressed any joy, or satisfaction
_ver a gift, or any thing found: 
_machsa, abadaasa.

to be quick, ready. Ama-_
mi, ma. Pamgach, act. trans.
_mgacha, amgachen, inamgach,
_gacha, pas. ipamgach, &c.
Ma-_ quickness, readiness. 
Ma-am-_ one who stirs up another.
simply.

angular, cornered, not round: mi, ma, amotto, mottoa, intend.
pamotto-motto, act. trans. amottomottoa, &c. nom.
motto-motto, an angular form.
Ma-amotto-motto, one who makes angles.

a bird.
achoar, dakoe, or damorij: unknown.
maars, a quail.
kole-_-kis, kissabre: a finch.
dollij, kalo: a wagtail.
koekoen-o-oog, a cuckoo.
zier, a sparrow.
k_ibil, a swallow.
togen, a s_ipe.
teo, a stork.
poa, a hen.
sarra ou oa, a crow.

gorrogot, gogoptoto, betoto: a dove.
pook, an owl.
kokko, a hen.
tebabon, a duck.

minan, maman, channa, channan, incchan, to eat away, to wear.
Poan, pi, pa, to feed, to give to eat, imp.
ipanna, channea, pass.
channan, imnan, inochannan, with respect to the person who is fed.
But iporan, inipoan, inoipoan, with respect to the food one eats.
Nom. from man, is inochan, food. 
From pan, is aan, feeding, a meal, and ma-aan, a feeder.
Karri, man-aan, to feed one another.
Aan o marpe, supper.
Maggo-aan, to feed.
Man o paissina, breakfast.
Man o lallian, dinner.
Man o maroop, supper.

ananadda, to do any thing first, minanamat, mamananat, or ananade o de boma,
go forward into the field; ananadd' o man inonoe, do you eat first.
Ananadden, inananad. inoananadden, als tûmman-aab.
Pûnanad, act trans. ananadden, inananad, pass.
ipanmad, &c. M_nad, one who preceds in drinking, working, &c.

to repeat five tim_
ma, panna-achpil, to do any thing, times, pi, pa, imp.act. trans.
a_, pila, ana achpilan, inama achp_
na achpila, pas. ip_na achpil,
achpil, &c. nom. ana achpil, five _.

minamacha, mama_
annacha-a. amachan, imannach
annachan, to play the fool with 
one, to joke. Pannacha, trans
cha, jesting. Ma-amacha, a j_
eight times.

to be often repeate_
ma. Panapida, to do any thing
pi, pa. imp. act. trans. anapida
pidan, inanapida, ino anapidan,
pida, pas. ipanapida, &c.
seven times.
four times.
nine times.
six times.
three times.
twice.
ten times.
once: mi, ma, antassa
sometimes, occasion.
now and then.

ininanniki, mam_nniki, aenikia, to jest, to trick.
Ditto adorned, as malla.
Panniki, imp. annikia, annikien, inanikien, ino annikien, ipanikia. pas.
ipaniki, inipaniki, inoipaniki.
Anniki, show, mockery.
Ma anniki, a mocker, a show man.

mi, ma, annoa, the twisting together of twigs, for basket work.
As merichichoa, to twine.
中文: 將細枝纏繞，用於製作籃子

釋義:
to be ripe; is said of fruits, mi, ma, aooma.
Pa-oom, a-oóma, ipaoôma, Oom, ripe.
jet black, see makosum.

many, many times, mi, ma, mapapan, intend.
mepan. Papan, to multiply. imp. 
apanna, apannan, inapannan, inoapannan, ipapanna, pas.
ipapan, inipapan, &c. 
Ma apan, one who makes much, a multiplier.
中文: 許多次；乘以；繁殖力強者

釋義:
to be short; mi, ma, mapappa-pappa, pi; pa, imp.
apappû-a, apapapa.
Papaûn, mapapaûn, pas. inapappa, &c.
Pappa, shortness.
Ma apappa, a shortener, apappa, a shortening.

to be bitter, mi, ma, ape, apean, inapean, inoapean.
Pap, to embitter.imp. apea, apean, inapean, ipapea, pass.
ipape, inipape, apean, &,c.
bitterness. Ma-ape an embit_

minapiegh, mamûpiegh_
cha, to fight with weapons _
apiegapiachcha, inapiech, in_
chen, the party is attacked _
apiech, a fighter. papiech, tra
to break in pieces. Papi_

mi, ma, apirra, iapir, w_
pect to the person who is a_
inapir, inoiapir, with respect
hand with which people fight
strike the contrary way; to sw_
arms backwards and forwards.
trans. apir, nomen. a smiting
wards. Ma-apir, one who so _.

minapies, mamapies,
apissen, in pis, ino apissen, to
any thing from any one and 
away. Papir, trans. nom. apis_
privation. Ma apis, a depriver _
muddy, thick.
any thing held together mouth.

minapor, mamapor, apor_
the chewing of betelnut.

mi, ma, apotoa, neutr.
thin as water. Papato, pi, pa_
apotoa, apotoan, inapotoan. inoap_
papotoa, pas. ipapoto, &c. to make thin as water.

mi, ma, apoûlaik, pass. neutr. 
bald-headed, imp.apaûlaik, apaûlaikan, ipapanlaik, pas.
ipapaûlaikan, &c.
Papaulaik. pi, pa. to make bald.
Paulaik, baldness.
Apaulaik, a making bald.
Ma-apaulaik, one who makes bald.
中文:
禿頭的（光頭的）； 
使土地光禿

釋義: a hare or rabbit

mi, ma, arabba, drunken.
Arab, drunkenness; morróarab, a great drunkard, inured to drinking.
Maarab, a drink.
Parab, trans. et act. to make drunk; 
pi, pa, araba, araban, inaraban, inoaraban, iparaba, &c.

mi, ma, hard.
Araasa. Maraas o bato, a hard stone; maraas a o, hard drink.
Maraas o ranied, a hard voice.
Parûas, trans. to make hard.
中文:
硬的；濃烈的（酒）；
硬朗的（聲音）；使努力

釋義:
mi, ma, araûla, neutr. intend.
mararûal. Paraal, act. et trans. flat, level, as land; intend.
pararaal, nom.
aroal, and araraal, evenness; maaraal, one who makes even.

minarabal, ma, araballa, standing, upright; 
marabal o assaban, the village is aroused.

the drawing together of clouds.
mi, ma arabboa, Parabbo, cloudy, araboa, rabboan, rir_
inorabboan, ipûrabboa. pass. i_, bo,&c.
Rabbo, clouds.

minaraggaragga garagga, to creep on the hands and knees.
Paraggaragga, tocaus_.

thick, coarse; ma_
a naupoot, coarse linen;
ragh a baron, a thick piece
Raghragh, thickness.

minarailen, mamarai_
la, arailan, maraila, inoarailen
suspicious of any one.

mi, ma, araisa, brave, disturbed.
Rais, disturbance, a disturbing; ma-arais a
amazon, a shrew, a scold
to disturb another; act. et tra_
araisan, inaraisan, pas. ipara_

twilight, between
and darkness. See also ma_
chûmmo.Rammorûmmo, no_

minûrana, manûrana
inûrana, inoûranan, the cutting of millet or rice, to mow.
Porarana, trans. arana, a mowing.
Ma-arana, to mow. Arrana, time or place of harvest.

mi, ma, mama: aranoadda, pas. aranoaddisit,
( with respect to those who hear it, )
the singing of the bird named adam on the right hand.

mi, ma, aria, pass. ari-in, inari-in, inoari-do.
on the left hand.

mi, ma, arapalla, neutr. blind.
Nom. rapal, blindness.
Adject. ma-arapal, blind.
ordinary, inferior.

mi, ma, arapisa, wicked.
Parapies, pi, pa, arapisa, iparapisa, to do wickedness.
Irapisen, inarapies, inoarapisen, iparapies, iniparapies, inoiparapies, rapies,
wickedness, from marapies, neutr; marapies, bad, adject.
Arapies, to make bad; from parapies, act, 
and it is the same that rarapies is in rummapies.

minarara, mamarara, imp.
arara-a, to enlighten; rarû, the light.
Parara, trans. et act. imp. arara-a, arara-an, inarara-an, inoarara-an, iparara-a, pass.
ipararû, inipar_rû, inoiparara.

intend. Rara, light. S.u_st.
arara, enlightening; ma-ara_
enlightener. Hence araraan-_
the full moon, that is, an enli_
moon, because when full it
enlightened by the sun.

big with child, mi, ma
ina. Pararûin, to be pregnan_
imp. act. trans. araraina, a_
inararain, inoararûinnen, ipa_
pass. ipararain, &c. Rarais, p_
cy. Ararain, do. Ma-ararain, gets with child.

minararam, mamûrara
dazzling of the eyes. Araram_
ararammen, inararam, inoara_
Pararam, trans. raram, a d_
ma-araram, one who dazzles.
a lord, a regent

mi, ma, aredoa, neutr.
ed, extended, as tûmcho.

mi, ma, archarcha
clear, able to see clearly. P_
cha, act. et trans. pi, pa, arch
archarchan, iparcharcha-a, pas.
iparcharcha, &c. Archarcha, clearness.

contract. pro. marach iabas, mi, ma, imp.
ariabassa. Pas. ariabassen, &c. 
sea shell-fish, muscles.
Pariabas, trans.

minaribaribat, mamaribaribat, aribaribatta, aribarihatten, inaribaribat, inoaribaribatten,
to hunt wild animals, birds, beasts, or fishes.

mi, ma, ariderieda, neutr.
heavy laden. Parideried, pi, pa, imp.
ariderieda, &c. iparideried, &c.

turbid, mi, ma, ariboa, ariboan, inariboan, inoariboan, ipariboa, pas.
iparibo, &c. Ribo, nom. muddy.
Hence aribo, a befouling; ma-aribo,
one who befouls.

according to heathen custom,
mi, ma, arien, a heathen practice.
a priest, a priestess.

to dry, as in puddles, morasses, or rivers; 
to be dried up by the sun.

mi, ma, imp. arioa, good, and rio, goodness.
Ario, an improvement, from pario; ma-ario, one who makes good.
Pario, pi, pa, &c. 
see in P. mario rio, nom. riorio, intend.

and intensively, mariggoriggo, mi, ma, ariggoa, neutr.
changeable; mariggo o atite airab. &c.
to change one's word or will. Pariggo, act. et trans.
mi, ma, arimasalla, clear-sighted, to look with wide open eyes.

minarior, mamarior, ariorra, to follow after; neutr.
parior, to leave behind; imp.
ariorra, ariorran, inarior, inoariorran, ipariorra, pass.
iparior, &c. rior, a following behind.
Arior, a leaving behind; ma-arior, to leave behind.
clear, clean, not foul.

mi ,ma, aripoedpoedda, to clew up, to wind, aripoedpoed, nom.
one who clews.

mi, ma, arikakka, neutr. straddling wide.
See also rûmmikak.
Parikak, pi, pa, imp. arikakka, arikakken, &c. iparikakka, pass.
iparikak, &c. act. et trans. to straddle.

to doubt; minarmimi, mamarmimi, mamirmia, armimian, inarmimian, &c.
aramimi, a doubting.
Parmimi, trans. Ma-armimi, a doubter

mi, ma, as maritûp, even, cut of straight, as a bamboo, or piece of wood transversely.
See rûmmichum.

whole, not in pieces, nor broken.
Written marunmo, mi,ma, arûmmoa.
Parûmmo, to make a whole. imp. arûmmoa, act.
arûmmoan, iparûmmoan. inoarûmmoan, iparûmmoa, pass.
trans. iparûmmo, &c. iummo, soundness; ma-arumm_, a healer; arummo, a healing.
mi, ma, to earn; same as marichum and marisap.

still, calm, also weak, pass.
See parne, and rummene.
Arne, calmness, stillness.
to swarm, to crawl.

far, deep, mi, ma, aroû, ro, distance, deepness.
Paro, imp. aroa ,aro-an, aroan, inaro, inoaroan, iparoa, pas.
_p_o iniparo, inoiparo; ma-aro, one who deepens. Aro, a deepening.

round, neutr. from rûmmomorromo, mi,ma, rommorromo, roundness.
Ma-aromorromo, one who rounds.

mi, ma, shadows, neutr. See rûnuûinno; ronno, shadow. Ronno an aijan, a shadowy plce.
Paronno, act. et trans. pi, pa, aronnoa, aronnoan, inaronnoan, *inoaronnoan, iparonnoa, pas.
ipûronno iniparonno, inoiparenno.
the time from  afternoon till  sun set. mi, ma, verbum.neutr.
mi, ma, arorra, arorren, &c. to run against any thing.

the squeamishness of the stomach after having eaten any thing nauseous. 
mi, ma, marossoal ja ma-achaan inai o micbam.
arorroa, together in common, &c. a crowd. or assembly. See pûrorro.

minûrpibi. mamarpibi. *arpibi, neutr. to wake up to awaken. Parpibi. pi, pa, imp. act, trans.
arpibia, arpibi-in, inarpibi, inoarpibian, pas. iparpibi. &c arpibi, a waking up.

without any thing, deprived of everything. Ta Deos marotul ja bog, God is incorporeal, i.e.
without a body, *pr. iut. ma, nom. deprivation, see the root rummûtul. Ma-arotul, one who is destitute. 
The Favorlang people do not use this word thus, but as the end of a chair, or table; 
still it comes to the same thing, for where any thing ends. there it exists no more.
to pick out a splinter with a knife or needle, minarri, mamarri, arrio, arrien, narri, inoarrien.
mi, ma, akallia, idem Takeis.
oebes to dig out, mi, ma, arria, pas. arrin, &c. see above.
roughly, cut off, from rummisup, mi, ma, as a bamboo, round stick, &c. transversely; item marrichum.

loose, notclosetogether. 
Marroak onaupoot, a loosely woven stuff, marroak o adda, paddy thinly sprung up.
an ornament made of shells.
minarup, mamarup, arûppû, aruppen, inoaruppen, to waive with the hand.

mi, ma, arsoasoalla, neutr. to seethe, or bubble up, as water does when it boil.
Parsoalsóal, imp. 
arsoasoûlla, arsoasoûllen, inarsoasoûl, inoasoasoal, iparsoasoalla, pas. soasoûllen, a seething.
Ma-arsoasoal, a seether.
ripe, spoken of field fruit. Artsi, nom. ripeness.
to tumble head over heels.

minasa, mamasa, asa, *ason, inasa, inoasan, to barter, to sell. Aso,ware, merchandize; 
ma-asa, a seller; masa, is also a noun, and means the same as in Takeis.
the evening.
well cooked.

mi, ma, assliadda, the nunk of a tree from which the branches are cut off, 
but the roots still left in the ground. Sallaad, such a trunk.
mi, ma, asammoa, withered; metaphorically used of those who are wasted by sickness.

minasannan, mamasannan, asanama, asanannan, inasanûnnan, to be envious, or jealous, to hate.
Saman, nomen. envy, jealousy, hatred. Ma-asannan, one who envies.
how. Masanno mato, atasas, qua mamario, maro, &c.
to pour out, see summaod.

mi, ma, asarammosûmmo, neutr. the dazzling of the eyes. 
Pasarammosammo, act. et trans. Sarammosûmmo. nom. a dazzing.
中文: 令人目眩的；眼花撩亂的

釋義:
minasarra, inamasarra, asarra, asarran, inasûrra, inoasarran, to look at, to behold.
Asarra, a beholding; ma-asarra, a spectator.
asassa, lazy, slow.

mi, ma, aselakkoa, entirely useless through, idleness; paselakko, trans. et act.
Selakko, laziness; maaselakko, one who makes another lazy.

mi, ma, to bring two ends together. Tabai pans a don masasoom ja ina don.
Tabai pans's house adjion mine. See sasoom, and summasoom. Susoom, nom.
pasasoom, trans. the place where two things join; maasoon; 
masasoom, also masasoom abaas, a complete year.

minasaso, mamasaso, asasoa, asasoan, inasasoan. 
inoasaso, to loiter, to be dissatisfied, to hate. Pasasso. trans.
Marasso ija ma, I am dissatisfied with you, and thus is taken to mean dislike and hatred. 
Sasso, displeasure, hatred, Ma-asasso, a pouter.

minasat, mamasat, asatta, asatten, inasat. inasatten,
 to carry two burthens along the road, bearing them by turas, and then setting them down.

minasau, mamasau, asau-a, asauen, inasaû, inoasauen, to beat seed out of the busk,
which is done on th ground, with a beater called tatta. Pasau, tran. asau.

minaseas, mamaseas, aseasa, aseasen, &c. to stand up, to rise up,  
Pasean, to cause to rise, pi, pa, ipaseasa, aseas, resurrection.

mi, ma, asearra, right on end. Pasear, to set up, asearren, inasear, inoasearren.
asarra, ipasear, &c. asear, nom. a setting up; ma-asear, a founder.

cold, mi, ma; masummak o barri, the northern monsoon.
Sumak, nom. coldness; ma-asûmak, cold.

minasibaû, mamasibau, asibaûa, asibauen, inasibaû, inoasibaû, to wrestle, to strive.
Pasibaû, transi. Asibau, a wrestling; ma-asibaû.
mi, ma, asia, asian, inasi, inoasian, to shower; masi a oetas. Asi, or asi a oetas, a shower.

mi, ma. imp, asicha. Masesich, intend. to pain. Neutr. also smarting from ardent spirits.
Pasich, act.et trans. Sich, pain, Sesesich, intend.
to be an old man, mi, ma, asjamma. Pasjam, trans; ma-asjem, one who makes old.
to play on a dubble flute with both nostrils. Minasdaûkirrap, mamasidaukirrap.
tough, mi, ma, asikka. Pasik, trans. asik, toughness; ma-asik, tough.
as madidden.
minasiklaû, asiklaua, to play on the flute, also set upright.
minasiliollio, mamasiliollio, to transfer, pas. Pasiliollio, trans. asiliollio, nom.
to echo, mi, ma, asinana. Pasinaan, trans. Sinaan, an,echo.

中文: 產生回音(在封鎖房間內)

釋義:
minasini, mamasini, asinia, asinian, inasini, inoasinian, to hear. 
Pasani, pi, pa, ipasini, trans. Asini, a hearing: ma-asini, a hearer.
to be like an old woman. Ma-asini, an old woman.

to be thus, mi, ma, asinia. Pasini, pi, pa, ipasini, to do thus. 
Maasini, one who does thus. Asini, thus.
mi, ma, asiorrumma, to play on the trumpet. Pasiorrûm, trans. nom. Orrûm, a trumpet.

mi, ma, asipirra, neutr. to push up slantwise. Pasipir, act. trans, imp. 
asipirra, asipirren, inasapir, inoasipirren, ipassipirra, pass. ipasipir, &c.

minasisiet, mamasisiet, to cool, the cooling of thing which have been heated by fire.
Pasisiet, act, et trans. People also say, mosisiet, pausisiet.

mi, ma, asisarratok, to play on a certain instrument like a bow.
Sarratok, the name of the instrument.
childish, Pasishiem, trans.Ma-asishiem, one who is childish.

mi, ma, asitabbilloa. to blow on the trumpet. Pasitabbillo, trans.
Tabbillo, a trumpet. Ma-asitabbillo, a trumpeter.

to button to, mi, ma, asitikka. Pasitik, trans. nom. 
Sasitik, a button, or any thing to button with, imp. asitikka, and ipasitikka.
intend. root summitik.

mi, ma, asidda, asidden, inasid, incasidden, to be high, elevated; the d is pronouncedhard.
Masidaija, baboch, i.e. the throw, or the shoot is high. Sid, nomen. high. Pasid, trans.
Thus men say, Maûchû asid, very high. Masid a to, spring flood, very high water.

mi, ma, to be sharp. Situm, sharpness. Pasitum, trans. imp. asitumma, &c.
Ma-asitum, a sharpener.

few, is never used alone, but always in combination; thus people say, 
maso qua, for a few, maso koeszie, a little, small. 
Item. maso mato, maro, maro, madich, micham, man, &c. 
rather great, far, sick; full of drinking, eating, &c.
mi, ma, asomma; inasom, inasom, inoasommen, to will, as merab.

minasóab, mamasóab, asóabba, pass. asoabben, inoasoabben ja ranied, to yawn, to gape.
Pasoab, transit. asoab, a gape. Ma-asoab, a yawner.

mi, ma, asoparreopeoa, asoparreopeoan, inasoparreopeoan, to go round; to run round.
Masoparreo, to go round frequently, or once. Asóparreo, asoparreopeo, a running round.
Asoparreoan or aijan, asoparreopeoan aijan, the place where.

mi, ma, asopyryta, asopyryten,inasopyryt, inoasopyryten, to spin.
The spindle with which one spins.
the north wind.
mi, ma, asopisoppa, even, ordinary, as mabazibat.

not of the same weight, mi, ma, asorra. 
 Pasor, trans.

mi, ma, asorra, as matsibo qua, neutr.
 to project a little in length beyond another; masoûsor, intend. 
 Pasor, trans.

head-ache, mi maasorieba, a pain in the head.
 Paso,rieb, trans. nom. 
 asorieb, head-ache.
a hind, or roe.

mi, ma, asosorro, same as makkas.
 Pasosor, tran.
 Asosor, accusation, reproach; ,ma-asosor, accuser.

lengthwise.
 Na aitanja masoso abak, I see the boat lengthwise: *imp asosoa.
 Pasoso, trans. Soso, length.
 Ma-asoso, long.

wet, mi, ma, aspea, paspe, to wet, trans.
 nom.
 aspe, moist, ma-aspe, wet.

mi, ma, aspotta, to be busy, to have something to do; 
means also all kind of disquietude of mind, which is unavoidable.
 Paspot, transi. 
 *see snpra, in the letter P: spot, nomen.business; maaspot, busy.

damp, moist, juicy.
 Tach, nom.subst.
 juice:mi, ma, atacha.
 Patach, trans. Ma-atach, a juice maker.

raw, green, i. e. youthful, unrpie, or uncooked. Serves also to express the growth of planets.
 Matacha da baron, a livng tree. 
 Patacha,tran.
 Tacha, nom. rawness:ma-atacha, one who makes raw.

mi, ma, atadacha, hot.
 Patadach, trans. to heat.
 Matadach o barri, the southern monsoon.
 Tadach, heat. Atadach, warming; ma-atadach, one who warms.

mi, ma, atadichoa, to remove from one's seat, to retreat.
 Patadicho, trans. Atadicho, a removal.

minatadoes, mamatadoes, atadoesa, atadoesan, matadoes, inoatadoesan, to fall over.
 Patadoes, trans. Tadoes, nom. ma-atadoes.

minasitosarri, mamasitosarri, assitosarria, assitosarrien, masitosarri, inoassitosarrien, the nose.
 Assitosarrien, ina-assitosarrien, inoassitosarrien, to blow with the nose on a certain *fute, called tosarri.
 Pinasitosarri, pi, pa, &c.

to let blood, to be bloody.
 Patagga, trans. et act. pi, pa, taga, nom.
 blood. Atagga aijan, the menses; ma-atagga, one who let blood.

fresh, not salted.
 Takan a to, fresh water.
 Patakan, trans. To make fresh. Takan, to refresh.
 Atakan, a refreshing; ma-atakan, a refresher.

perhaps, it is possible, mi, ma.
 Talam, nom.
trodden down, as a field of rice, barely, grass, &c.
mi, ma, talûmtûmma, covered up, in order to promote perspiration.

heavy, also pregnant: taûch, heaviness, trans. et act. 
Pataûch; ma-ataûch, one makes heavy.

full. spoken also of the mind. 
Patapo, to fill . trans. et act. pi, pa, imp. 
atapaû, atapoan, &c. pass. ipatapo, &c. tapó, fullness.
Atappo, a filling up; ma-atappo, a filler.
athwart, tarribat, nom. crossness; ma-atarribat, cross.

to lay on one side, to do any thing in a sinister manner.
Taragi, nom. sinister.

minattarromatto, mamatarromatto, to dream. Atarromatta, imp.
Tarromatta, nom. a dream. Patarromatta, tran. ma-atarromatta, a dreamer.
to do any thing first; minatas, mamatas, atasa.

numerous; is not applied further than to men. Patasas, trans. 
Tasas, a number ma-atasas, one who multiplies.
中文: 眾多的；大量的(不適用於男人)

釋義:
mi, ma, atattabach, neutr. first, principal. Patattabach, act. et trans. tattabach.
precedence, preference., taken adverbially.

excellent, worthy, imp. atasoa, taso, excellence; ma-ataso, one who glorifies. 
Ataso, glorification, imp. atasoa. Patasso, act. 
et trans,pi ,pa, atassoa, atassoan, inatassoan, &c. pass. ipatasso,&c.

mi, ma, atattoa, neutr. low, as to situation, as mararag.
Patatto to lower, imp. atattoa, atattoan, inatattoan, &c. pass. ipatatto, &c.
Tatto, as rarach; atatto, as ararach.

minatik, mamatik, the ceasing of wind, rain, thunder, lightning, &c. imp. atikka.
Patik, trans. atik, nom. the ceasing of a storm.
that which repeatedly ceases.

mi, ma, atillikka, neutr. blind of one eye, so that men cannot see the light.
 Tillik such blindness; ma-atillik, one thus blind.

minatincho, is said of the sea water,
 when it stands still between ebb and flood, because the sea then appears swollen.
It is  also said of the belly, when men are full, or when belly swells. 
It betokens also a little putrid, because when any thing begins to stink it swells up.

minatinnaam, mamatinnaam, atinnama, &c. to precede, to lead a train. 
Patinnaam, pi, pa, &c. to go before. Tinnaam, before; ma-atinnaam, a forerunner.
lost, gone, mi, ma, atissa, neutr. Patis, trans.
to melt, neutraliter, mi, ma, atoa, or melted, pass. pato.transiti.

great, matoto, intend. mato, mi, ma, atoa, pato, trans. et act. 
Ato, greatness; ma-ato, a magnifier. Comes from pato, ato, a magnifying.
minatoa, mamatoa, atoa, to hasten. Patoa, trans. atoa, nom.
(the first o short) mi, ma, atobacha, as mauranies.

mi, ma, atolassa, neutr. blind of one eye, so that men cannot see the light.
Tollas, such blindness; ma-atollas, one thus blind.
a large unwieldy person.
mi, ma, and ma-tai-tai, in the same way as maries, pestered with fire-flies.
mi, ma, atsiaboroa, to hit the mark. Patsiûboro, trans. aboro, aim.

minatorro, mamatorro, atorroa, atorroan, inatorroan, inoatorroan, to doze, to slumber.
Patorro, trans. Atorro, slumbering; ma-atorro, a slumberer.

mi, ma, atsiolea, atsiolean, inatsiole, inoatsiolean, to game, to play, as the Chinese do. 
Patsiole, trans. Ole, nom. gaming; ma-atsiole, a gamester.

mi, ma, atshesia, atshesian, inatshesy, inoatshesian, odd numbers, as 3,5,7,&c. 
where one exceeds. Patshesy, trans. tshesy, unevenness.

mi, ma, atûppacha, neutr. patuppach, act. et trans. between two, nom.
tûppach, between; tûppach aijan, an intervening space.

and karri, or kar, compositum cum nomine, praetor significationem verbi a quo nomen derivatum est,
vicissitudinem ejus includit. *mitation in doing any thing, as  maû-tattis, nom.
from tûmmis, to reject mutually, or to reject at the same time.

minau-aat, mamau-aat, imp. aúaûta, neutr. to be infested, as with lice, scurvy, pock, &c.
Paûaat, trans. et act. au-aat, nom. an, infection;maau-aat, infections, as ma-an-aat ó digh arapies,
an infections complaint, that which affects another, as original sin, Pau-aat, pi, pa, imp.
auûatoa, auaaten, ...

Mau-kar-aitaita, minau-aitaita, mamauaitaita, auaitaita, auaitaitan, inaûaitaitan, to imitate what men have seen. Pauautaita, pi, pa, &c. to do the like Compounded of kar-mau and ataito, nom. from mitaita.
Mau-adat, minau-adat, mamau-adat, auadadda, to fall to logger heads, auadadden, &c, Paûadat, trans auadan, nom. logger heads; ma-auadat, a quarreller.
Maû-alopalopak, to come against one suddenly.
Maû-aso-asot, of different lengths, not the same length, mi, ma, asoasodda, chaûaseason, trans.
Maû-asot, the same as two, mi, ma, asódda. Pau-asot, trans, ason, nom.
Maúbebiech, mimaûbebiech, mamaâbebiech, aûbebicha, aûbebichen, inaûbebich, inoaubebichen, to pull by the hair. Aubebich, nom. Ma-aubebich.

Maûchil, mi, ma, aûchilla, neutr. accomplished, as machult. Pauchil, to accomplish, trans. et act, imp. ipauchilla, auchillen, inaûchil, inoaughillen, auchilla, pas. ipauchil, &c. Aûchal, a consummation; ma-auchil, a finisher.
Maúcho, lousy, mi, ma, aóchoa. Paócho, tram. acho, a louse; ma-aocho, a louser.
Maû kar motto, chacholliet, mi, ma, the same as maû-sasaki motto.

Maûchûs, very, mi, ma, achûssa; maû-chus madich, very sick, perhaps also too sick, as mauchus mazilo, too long, also bold courageous, maûchûs, o aga, skillful with missile weapons; maûchus o babido, clever at the pen. Aûchusso,aûchussen inaûchûs,inoauchussen,imp. ipaûchussa, pass. ipauchussen, or auchussan, with respect to the instrument with which any thing is done. Pauchus,trans. et act. butokens any thing consummated, also leaving off; means also to dart across, or run through. Aûchûs,completeness, used also adverbially; maaûchûs, an accomplisher.
Maûdûm, dark, applied also to the mind, mi, ma, aûdûmma. Paûdûm, trans. odûm, darkness; ma-odûm, a darkener.
Maûkat, minaûkat, mamaûkat, aûkatta,aûkattan, inaûkattan, inoaûkattan, to love, to rejoyce. Paûkat, trans. aûkat, love, joy; ma-aukat, a lover.
Maûkatir, mi, ma, aûkatirra, &c. as madûddo. Paûkatir, trans. nom. katir.
Maûnionis, mi, ma, aûnionisa, aûnionisen,inaunionis, inoaunionissen, intend. inaûnis, especial. Paunionis, trans. nom. _aûnionis, particularity, peculiar property.

Maûnisso arûch, minaûnisso arach, mamaûnisso arach, aûnisso arach-a, aûnisso arach-en, &c. toappropriate to one's self, by taking possession or inheriting of another'sgoods. Paûnisso-arach, trans. Aûnisso-arach, nom. ma-aunisso-arach, an heir.
中文: 獲得或繼承某物以適合自己

釋義: Maûnis, mi, ma, aûnisa,pricate, not common, se maûnis patodon, he is gone to reside at his own place. Paûnis, act. et trans. imp. aûnisa, aûnisaa, inaûnissen, inoaûnissen, ipaunisa, pas. ipaûnis, &c. Aunis, property; maaûnis, proprietor; maûnis o ala, mi, ma, imp. aûnis o ala, to speak to particularly, to testify.
Maûpi, minaupi, mamaûpi, any thing beaten small or fine. See paûpi; ma-aupi, a beater.
Maûpies, minaupies,mamaupis,aupisû, aûpisan, inaûpisan, inoaupisan, to strive about any thing, to scramble. Paûpies, trans. aûpies, a scrambling; ma-aupies, a scrambler.
Maûpulla, mi, ma, aûpûlla, to seek gain or advantage by any means. Aûpûl-, la, nom. a seeking of gain: ma-aû-pûlla, a gain seeker.
中文: 以任何手段尋求、獲得或提升

釋義:
Maûranies, minaûranies, mamaûranies,
aûranisa, auranisen, &c. to play; to joke. Pauranies, trans. Auranies, play; ma-auranies, a jester.
Mauroman, and mauroma-roman, intend. mi, ma, imp. auromanomama, to differ, to vary. Pauroma-roman, pi, pa, act. et trans. to make different. Auroman, nom. difference.

Mausa, mi, ma, is said of a field when the weeds are burned down, or other wise cleared away. Pausa, pi, pa, osaá, pass. osa-an, inosa-an, ino-osaan. Osa, nom, a clearing away; from posa; ma-aosa, one who clears away. Ausa, clearness, from mausa.
中文: 指野草都被燒光或是清理乾净的區域

釋義: Mau-sasakimotto, mi, ma, transverse. Compounded from mau, and sasakimotto.
Mausi, white, mi, ma, ausia. Pausi, trans, Osi, whiteness; ma-aosi, white, as ma-ausi.
Mautatarroggi, changed, either knowing ly or unknowingly, to change another's goods through deceit. From tummaroggi, comp. of mau and tattarroggi.
中文: 通過欺詐手段換取他人貨物

釋義: Mau-tattubboel, mi, ma, to visit each other backwards and forwards.
Mautattis, to reject, to abandon, as kar tattis, mi, ma, autatisa, autattisan, inautattis, inoautattisan. Pautattis, trans, but includes changes.
Mautod, unfruitful, spoken as well of beasts as men. Also fruitless, as people give up anything that is fruitless.Pautod, trans. autod, unfruitfulness; Ma-autod, unfruitful.
Mautsiri, minautsiri, mamautsiri,artless, ignorant, inexperienced, imp, autsiri. Pautsiri, trans, Autsiri, ignorance, Ma-autsiri, an ignoramus, as maautsiri.
中文: 天真的，樸實的，無知的，無經驗的

釋義: Mazibdillach, foul, improper, mi, ma, aziballacha, trans, paziballach, maballach, mi, ma, aballacha, to be foul; nom. Ballach, all kinds of things. Ma-aballach, one who acts disorderly.
中文: 違規的，不正確的，不適當的

釋義: Mazibochor, minazibochor, mamazibo chor, aziboehorra, to lie uncomfort ably, without pillow, coverlid, &c'
中文: 不舒服地躺著（沒有枕頭、被子等等）

釋義:
Mazichil, minazichil, mamazichil, azi chilla, (the part: are not otherwise used than with respect to the persons who are lamented, and are formed not from the neuter, but from the active pazichil.) azichillan, inazichillan, ino azichillan, sorrowful. Pazichil, act. et trans. pi, pa, act. imp. trans. azichil la, ipazichilla, &c. to make sad. Pichil, sadness. Ma-achil, one who is
sad.
Mazich-zich, that which is badly smooth ed and ironed out, mi, ma, azichzicha. Pazich-zich, nom. The root zimich zich, see in Z.
Matshis, brackish, saltish, mi, ma, atshisa, patshies, act. to salt, trans. imp. "atshia, atshisin, inatshis, inoatshisin, ipatshisa, &c. Tshis, saltness. Atshis a salting. Ma-atshis, a salter.
Mazigingin, minazigingin, mamazigingin, aziginginna, to halt, to limp. Pazigingin, atzigingin, a halting. Maatsigingin, a halter.
Mazhies, minazhies, mamázhies, azhis-a, azhis-in, &c. to carry on enmity. Pazhies, pi, pa, ipazhies-a, &c. Azhies-in, an enemy. Azhies, enmity, whence karri or mau azhies. Ma-ázhies, an enemy.
Mazikoar, minazikoar, mamazikóar, azi kóara, azikóarran, inazikoaran, to jump, to jump over any thing.
Mazikáp, just, enough, sufficient. Ma atsikap, sufficient. Patsikap, trans.
Matsilo, long, high. Tsilo, length, height. Patsilo, trams. Ma-atsilä, long.
Maziloch, mi, ma, azilócha, diligent. Mazilóch a rima, dextrous. Pazilóch, trans. Ziloch, nom. Ma-aziloch.
Mazimán, minaziman, mamaziman, azi manna, azimannan, &c. to lay up trea sures. Patsiman, trans. atsiman, a treasure. Ma-atsiman, a hoarder.
Maziporriporri, minaziporriporri, ma maziporriporri, aziporriporria; to fall down through giddiness or weakness; spoken only of men and beasts.
Mazipi, minazipi, mamazipi, azipia, to rage, to make a noise. Azipi, a row. Ma-azipi, a fury.
Mbarri, minobarri, manobarri, obárria, abarrian, to stand. Paubarri, transi. It is really mobarri, but the (o) is so pronounced that it is not heard.
Mbûkkas, white, blank. Bukkas, the u short.
Mbe, minobe, mamobe, obea, obean, inobean, to go away, to leave. It is mobe, but the (o) is bitten off short, so as not to be heard. Paube, trans. to drive away.
Mbod, mienbod, máambod, the falling off of hair, or feathers.
Mbá, as móba, that by which. Pauba, transiti.
Mpa, as mópa.
Mpákko, as mopákko.
Mpákkopakko, as mopákkopakko.
Mpát, as mopát.
Mpus, to pull up grass with a piece of crooked wood, called arro.
中文: 用一個彎曲的木頭除草

釋義: Mchab, mienchab, maamchab, chabba, chabben, ienchab, inochabben, to steal; is also taken for máchab, in general.
Mchách, mienchach, maamchach, chacha, chach-en, ienchach, inochachen, to dream.
Me, mine, mame, ea, ean, inean, ino, ean, to despise. Paie, trans: nom. act. a despising. Mea, act, a despiser.
Me, to do any thing superfluous: differs from barras, and bior.

Mé-aab, mineaab, mameaab, eaba, ea ban, inoaban, inoeaban, to precede a
nother in doing a thing; hence meaab mabá, to know, before hand, meab paha, to preconceive. Meapattis, to foretell. From meaab-maba, nomen, aijaab-maba, foreknowledge. From meaab-nmita, nom. aijaab-mita, prescience. From meaab-pattite, nom. aijaab-patite, prophecy. From meeaab-merab, nom, aijaab-merab, predetermination. From meaab-meries, nom. aijaab-meries, preparation. And is in other cases
中文: 在做某件事中領先/優於別人

釋義: Méab, mineab, mameab, Éappa, eappan, lineappan, to assist, to help in battle.
Méacha, mimeacha, mameacha, eacha, eachan, ineachan, to beg, to pray.
Me-adam, mi, ma, e-adamma, eadam man, ineåddammam, inoeāddam, to drive birds away from the fruit. Peadam, trans. Aiadam, nom. a driving away.
中文: 把鳥類從果實旁邊趕走

釋義: Mébabo, mimebabo, mamebabo, to drive, not to sink, neutr, morpies.
Mébonna, see mibónna.

Medadórri, minedadorri, mamedadorri, edadórria, edadorrian, inedadorrian, inoedadorrian, to quarrel with another. Aidadorri, nom. quarreling. This word is compounded of mau or kar, and means to quarrel together, again and again. Ma-aidadorri, a quarreller.
Me-ich, narrow, mi, ma, echa, Pai-ich, *trans, nom. e-ich, a strait. Ma-e-ich, narrow,
Me-il, mine-il, mame-il, e-illa, e-illan, ineillan, inoe-ilian, to fear, to take care, to avoid.
Mekap, mime, mame, ekappa, pass. ekappaggete ja baros, the settling of birds, on trees, or houses, after their flight. This is the same as mikkap, pakap.
中文: 鳥類遷徙后的栖息地（樹上或房頂）

釋義: Mema, fat, any thing very fat. Ema, fatness.
Meodûp, mimeodup, mameodup, eoduppa, the setting of sun or moon. Aiodup, nom. a setting.
Meràb, minerab, mamerab, erabba, erabben, inerab, inoerabben, to will.
Meried, an eel.

Merien, minerien, mamerien, erina, eri men, inerien, inoerien, to do, to make, also to arrange between parties. We use it also for create. Pairien, to do, to make, to form, nom. subst, airien, a making, creation. Ma-airien, maker, creator; as ma-atap.
Meries, slanting, sly, mi, ma.
Mero, mi, ma, eroa, eroan, &c. Pairo, trans, the teeth on edge by eating sour things. Aero, nom. on edge.
中文: 用來吃酸東西的邊緣的牙

釋義:
Mero-os, minero-os, mamero-os, ero-ossa, ero-ossan, inero-ossan. ino-ero-ossan.
to sit: Takeis; Mikód, idem. Pairo-os.
imp. act et trans. to sit or cause to sit, airossa, airo-ossen, inairo-os, ino-airo–
ossen,ipairo-Gssa, &c. airo-Os, a sitting.

Merabróob, mi, ma, eroobrooba, neutr. to
turn the edge of a knife, &c. pairoob
roob, act. et trans.

Meroos, mineroos, mameroos. erósa, erósan, ineroos, ino-eróosen, to marry, to he united. Meroos o badda, erosan ja sini. Airoosan, a son in law. Tamau o airoosan, tanai o airoosan, father and mother in law. Pairo-os, to marry out, imp. airóosa, airoosan, inairosan, inoai rosan, &c. ipairosa, pass. ipairoos, &c.
Merúmrüm, mimerúmrūm, mamerumrum, to sink in the water, as morpies.
Metórro, mimetórro, mametorro, etérroa, etorroan, inetórröan, inoetorroan, to warm one's self at the fire. Paitorro, pi, pa, ipaitorroa, ipatorro, &c.
Mgdgh, any thing strong, as arrack, &c.
Miach, foul, dirty, mi, ma, iacha. Payach, pi, pa, trans. et act to infeet. Aiach, nom. filthiness, infection. Maaiach, one who infects.
Wiialla, minialla, mamialla, jalla, jallan, iniallan, inojallan, to look at anything with attention, Aialla, observation, beholding.
Mián, miman, mámian, iánna, iannau, iniannan, inoiannan, the rest and relaxation, which the Favorlang people observe for several days, whenever a chief dies; also the proclamation of holy days.
Miarar, foul, dirty, mi, ma, inoatra, paiarar, trans,
Mibiech, mini, ma, ibicha, ibichen, inibich, incibiecheu, to drag along.
Mibonbon, mi, ma, the point blunted.
Mibonna, minibonna, mamibonna, ibon na, ibonnan, inibónna, inoibonnan, to seek for game, to hunt. Paibonna, tran.
Micham, mimicham, mamicham, ichammam, ichamman, &c. to smoke. Micham o chatto, to smoke tobacco.
Micho, right, well, as it should be.
中文: 正確的，好的，正如其本應的樣子

釋義:
Midárdar, mi, ma, idardarra, close, near
together, not loose, the opposite of marroak. Paidardar, act. et trans. aidardar, nearness. Ma-aidardar, one
who makes close.
Midáchûm, mi, ma, idachumma, pass. idachumman, &c. to overshadow. Paidachûm, trans, dachûm, a shadow.
Mididten, as madidden.
Midod, minidod, mamidod, idodda, idod dan, inidod, inoidodden, where out? idoddan, inidoddan, inoidoddan, to lade, to take out with a spoon. Pai dod, pi, pa, ipaidodda, &c. idem.
Mi-ech, mi, ma, stupid, not sharp, mi-eer, neutr. Pai-ech, trans. and pai-eer.
Miel, miniel, mamiel, ila, ilen, iniel, inoilen, to twist rope. Also to stop, to prevent, to keep back, to dissuade.
Migarrorro, mima, igarrorroa, igarrórroan, ja, ta, to assemble, to come together, as mitarroan, and mafiloon. Paigarrórro, trans. Aigarrórro, an assembly. Aigarrórroan, a place of meeting.

Mikkáp, mi, ma, means to hold on, to to cleave, is said of the birds, when after a flight they come and rest on a tree or house, because they hold on with their claws, and as it were cleave fast; imp. ikkappa. Paikap, to stick, to cleave, activ. et trans. aikap, nom.
Mikkil, minikkil, mamikkil, ikilla, ikillan, inikillan, inoikillan, to fear, to be afraid, also to gird one's self, to watch.
Mikinno, damp, clammy; mibo, paibo, Takeis. Paikinno.
Miko, wrinkled; iko, a wrinkle. Paiko, transitiv.
Mikotiko, same as miko.
Mikod, as meroos, to sit, mi, ma, ikodda, &c. Paikod, trans. nom. aikod.
Migogh, mi, ma, igogha, slow, lazy.
Mikorros, minikórros, mamikorros, ikorrossa, to descend. From this imperat. appears to come the Tiloese word, Mikorrossokosso tarran, a steep descemit; n the Favorlang dialect, mikaussokosso tarran.
Milleb, minilieb, mamilieb, iliba, iliben, inilieb, inoiliben, to look behind over the shoulders. Pailieb, trans.
Milip, the lapse of time, whether past or future, mi, ma, pailip, trans.
Miloslos, mi, ma, aloslossa, neutr, the same as meroobroob. Pailoslos, trans.
Mimoas, minimoos, mamimoos, imosa, imosan, inimosan, inoimosan, to look sour. Paimoos, trans, nom, aimoos.
Minamnis, and minanunnis, mi, ma, imp. inănanissa, the same as maûronnan, and maûromaroman. Painannis, act. et trans. ainanis, nom. difference.
Miog, miniog, mamiog, jogga, joggan, inioggan, inojoggan, to fall from a high place: also an untinmely birth; hence ioggan, a miscarriage, Paigg, trans. nom.aiog, a fall
Mini, this. Is also a verb.
Miochóoch, miniochooch, mamiochooch, iochoocha, to sink down, to shrink.
mióoch, to shrink at once, nom. aiooch, aioochóoch, paidóoch, paioochoóch, tran.
Mio-a, mi, ma, i-o-a, to clear away new fields that have not been worked before.
中文: 收拾以前沒用過的新區域

釋義: Mion, minion, mamion, imp. ionna, jónnan, inionnan, inoiónnan, to shrink together. Idem miko. Paion, as paiko, trans. nom. aion, albaiko.
Mipies, minipies, mamipies, ipisa, ipisen, inipies, inoipisen, to cut through. Paipies, trans, nom. aipies.
Mírras, minírras, mamírras, irrassa, irrassán, inirrasseh, inoirrassan, to weep, to lament. Pairras, trans. nom. airras; mirrairas, intend. nom. airrairas.
Mirrít, minirrít, mamirrít, irta, irten, inirit, inoritten, to make pack-thread. Pai-irrít, trans. nom. airrit.
Misapiel, mi, ma, isapila, see summapiel.
Misi, minisi, mamisi, isia, to make water. Paisi, trans. nom. isi, urine.
Mishies, mi, ma, aishiesa, pas. aishiesen, &c. ja chau, to make fire with a piece of wood. Pashies, trans.
Misor, minisor, mamisor, isorra, isorren, inisor, inoisorren, to set fire to.
Misyk, mi, ma, asykka, asykken, ina syk, &c. to hang or lean over. Paisyk, trans, nom. aisyk, a jutting out.
Misósso, mi, ma, isossa, a leak, used only of pots, pans; and not of a house or roof. Paisosso, trans. nom. aisosso.
Mita, minita, mamita, ita, itan, initan, inoitan, seen; paita, to shew. Aita, sight; ma-aita, one who sees well.
Mitaita, same as mita, nom. aitaita.
Mitam, minitam, mamitam, itamma, itammen, initam, inoitammen, to borrow. Paitam, to lend, pi, pa, ipaitam.
Mitapao, mi, ma, itapao, itanpao, initan pao, &c. nearly like mita, but it means to look on any thing with attention.
Mitaronno, smooth, slippery.
Mitarroom, to meet together, the coming together of a multitude; minitarroom, mamitarroom, itarromma, &c. mitarroom o assaban o Capitein, the village collects when the chief comes.
Maûloom, mi, ma, aûloma, the same as mitalroom. Affloom, nom. a coming together. Don o aûloman, as don o arorroaijan a meeting house.
Mitara o tarran, when two ways come together in one.
中文: 兩條路匯合成為一條路

釋義:
Mitas, minitas, mamitas, itassa, itassan, initassan, inoitassan, to stay out all
night.

Mitatsiel, to cleanse; mitatsiel o don, o ta, to cleanse the house, or the place. Ta Deos mutatsil o torro boa innai
arapies, God cleanseth us from sin.
Mitehabo, minitebabo, mamitebabo, itebahoa, to look up high.
Mitírpo, minitírpo, mamitírpo, itírpoa, to look down below.
Mitoch, tough, not easily torn asunder.
Mittin, minittin, mamittin, ittinna, ittinnen, inittin, inoittinnen, to threaten any one hehind his back.
Mkách, yellow, green.
Mkákach, pale, like sick people.
Mkár, hoarse. Inkár jiri, a hoarse throat
Mo-ab, minóab, mamoab, o-abba, to increase in number or size, to cause increase. See paſab.
Móab, makes the comparative degree, as moab a mato, mario, greater, better.
Moár, spoken of food, means lukewarm; spoken of a sick person, it means hot; spoken of the face, it means ashamed, angry, or rather blushing: differs from matadach.
中文: （食物）溫熱的；（病人）熱的；（臉）羞愧的，生氣的，臉紅的

釋義: Móas, minoas, mamóas, óasa, oásan, imoasan, ino-oasan, to walk.
Moba, minoba, mamoba, oba, drowsy, as mba.
Mobàrri, same as mbárri, to stand.
Mobe, same as mbe, either from, or to one's place. Paûbe, pi, pa, ipaûbe, to drive away.

Mocharanna and mocharanna-channa, mi, ma, ocharanna-channa, pass. ocharanna-channan, recovery from sickness: the sickness, is mocharanna-channa, but the body. Ocharanna-channan. Paucharanna-channa, trans. Aûcharanna-channa, recovery.
Mochib, minochib, mamochib, ochibba: ochibben, inochib, ino-ochibbeu, to carry alone. Paûchib.
Mocho, mi, ma, ochoa, ochoan, inochoan, ino-ochoan, to seek lice.
Modaraû, half round, modaraſi ja eidas, the half moon.
Modaraûdaû, round as a circle, modaraûdaû ja eidas, the full moon.
Moddon, the gables of a house.
Módon, minodon, mamódon, odóma, odómen, inodon, ino-odónnen, to harden one's self against any thing.
Moeda, mi, ma, oeda, oedan, inoeda, inooedan, how is it?
Móela, minóela, mamóela, the fall of the dew. Oela, the dew, hoar frost.
Moelapillap, full, overflowing.
Móetas, minóetas, mamóetas, to rain, oetássan, inoetassan, ino-oetassen. Paûtas, pi, pa, ipaûtassa, &c. Oetas, Tālū.
Magaggimo, mi, ma, disturbed, neutr. see gûmmaggimo; applied also to the mind; magaggimo atshies, disturbed in mind.
Mokákiach, indisposed, a little unwell, a weariness in the limbs.
中文: 有一點不舒服，（四肢）疲倦

釋義: Mogoch, mi, ma, imp, ogocha, pas, ogóchen, inogoch, ino-ogochen, to play. Paûgoch, trans. ditto. augoch.
Mokalossikot, mi, ma, to curl, neutr. See Rummalossikot,
Mokap, minokap, mamokap, okappa, okappen, inokap, ino-okappan, to meet any one.
Mokaraldikala,loose, open, not close wo ven, used only of linen, stuffs, & mats.
Mogarini, and mogarinigini, round like a ball, also to roll. Pass. written mogarini. From gummarinigini.
Mokibach, notched; mokibach o silok, the knife is notched; kibach, a notch; okibacha, neutr, see the root ma-aukibach, notched, adject. kummibach.

Mokikiet, torn, from kummikiet, nai. ma, okikiedda, act. et trans. aukikied. pi, pa; aukikiedda, aukikieddan, inau kikieddan, inoaûkikieddan, ipauki kidda, pas. ipaukikieddan, &c. nom. kikied, a rent; ma-aukikied, rent.

Móddon, means to take up a burthen. Also to increase one's burthen, and generally to increase or double a per son's work, for the first people say. moddon o paûchiep, and moddon o pásabo; and for the second, moddon o pataap, or pairien.
Moláppa, minoláppa, mamoláppa. oláppa, olappan, &c. to wander, to err.

Molliol, minólliol, mamólliol, olliélla, olliéllan, inolliállan, ino-olliollan, to help any one in a work for friendship sake, and not for pay. A-olli-ol, help, as aùlliol; ma-a-olli-ol, a helper, as ma-aulliol.
中文: 出於友誼在工作上幫助某人

釋義: Molso, the stenchions or posts, which stand by the side of houses.
Momas, minomas, mamomas, omássa. omassan, inómas, ino-omássen, to salt, to pickle.
Momach, mi, ma, the running of paper in writing, but with large blots; it differs from mabad.
Momatas-ó, as matas-o.
Momo, a mole, the people of Formosa consider these as poisonous, and will not approach them.
中文: 一種鼴鼠，Formosa人認爲其有毒故不會靠近

釋義: Monách-onacho, minonachonach-o, &c. the overflowing of rivers.
Mooch, mi, ma, oocha, pass. oochen, &c. to carry earth in a basket.
Mood, mi, ma, ooda, ooden, inood, inooden, to bind sheaves or bundles, as of paddy, or millet; nom. óod, a sheaf. Ood adda, ood batur, a bundle of paddy or millet.
Mónad, minónad, mamónad, to burn; onad, a flame.
Mopareopeó, mi, ma, opareopéoa, opareopéoan, to delay. Paripareopeo, trans. aupareopeo, lingering.
Mópat, minopat, mamopat, opatta, opatten, inopat, ino-opatten, to go to meet ope: otherwise written mpat, the (m) short, without a vowel. Hence simpat, as it were si (i. sossi, or sinossi) mpat.
Moor, mi, ma, imp. ora, pass. oren, &c. Paoor, trans. same as gûmmoch.
Mopus, same as gûmmos, to pull out grass with a piece of wood called arro.
Mópa, minopa, mámopa, as mpá, aupa, nom. flight. Aupaijan, a place to fly to; aûpaijan o chaar, the resort of birds.
Mopákko, minopákko, mamopákko, to overflow, to run over; mopakkopákko, to overflow much.
Mopesik, mi, ma, opesikka, neutr. bruised, broken. See pesik.
Mópiech, mi, ma, opiecha, opiechan, inopiech, ino-opiechen, to shrink; the opposite of poddik.
Móra, whorish, a whore; mor' i slibus, an abandoned woman, given up to prostitution.
Mórab, mi, ma, orabba, to go and return the same day to and from any place.
中文: 在一天内去某地並返回

釋義: Morábbies, minorábbies, mamorábbies, the ebb of the sea: aûrabbies, nom. the ebb.
Mórach, minorach, mamorach, orácha, iorách, iniorach, inoiorach, to grumble.
Moránni, mi, ma, oránnia, as morrod.

Mórich, minorich, mántorich, oricha, orichen, &c. to live, to maintain one's life. Porich, trans, to support, feed, and maintain another, nom. porich, is not in use for being, but means maintenance, feeding.

Morich, mi, ma, oricha, neutr, has no noun, as morich, to keep alive. Porich, pi, pa, oricha, pass, orichen, inorich, ino-orichen, to feed. Aurich, a feeding; ma-aurich, a feeder. Paurich, pi, pa, ipaûricha, pass. ipáurich, inipaurich, inoipaûrich, to make lively; also to cure of disease.

Morich, mi, ma, origha, the growing of the body, pas, orichan, &c. Aûrich, nom. a growing. Porich, idem, ût sûpra, to feed another. Hence maaurich, such a feeder. Paurich, ùt súpra, to provide for another.

Moriedda, minoriedda, mamoriedda, oriedda, orieddan, inorieddan, inoorieddan, to run away from those to whom we belong, as parents, partners, village, &c., Pauriedda, ditto. The root is rummiedda: ma-auriedda, such a fugitive. Aûriedda, such a flight,
Moriet a sisia, about half past one P. M.
Moróog, minoróog, mamiróog, orogá, orogán, inorogán, ino-orogan, to fall down; mûrroog o chûbboen, to have the falling sickness. Paurong, trans
Morpies, mi, ma, to sink; the opposite of mebabo, to drive,
Morús, cool, fresh. Patrus, trans.
Mórras, roomy, wide

Marihul, decaying, dilapidating, mi, ma, ariballa. Pauribal, act. et trans. auriballa, auribailan, inaûriballan, ino-aûriballan, pi, pa, ipauriballa, pas. ipauribal, inipaùribal, inoipauribal, nom. auribál, dilapidation; ma-auribal, any thing falling to decay. Oriballa, to cause to decay.
Morikak, to stride, as the legs of a man, mi, ma, orikakka, see rummikak; also márikak, imp. arikakka, hence aurikak, a straddling; rikak, ditto. ma-aurikak, straddling.
Morraia, mi, ma, aûraia, neutr. same as macho moraia, see above; aûrraia, nom
Morrod, minorrod, mamorrod, orródda, orródden, inórod, ino-orródden, to forsake, to dissimulate. Paûrod, see in P.
Marrûan, black.
Morroór, minorroor, mamûrroor, orrora, orroren, inorroor, ino-orróren, to scratch the ground, after the native manner; to plough. Pauroor, ditto. Aûroor, nom. a harrow, a plough.
Mórtatach, to scatter, neutr. minortatach, mamortatách, ortatácha, with regard to the place. Ortatachan, inortatachen, see also pautatach, activ.
Mórzi, frightened, nom. aúrzi.
Mossd, minossă, mamossá, osse, or monea, to go away. It has sossa, in the 3rd person, present, in the perfect si nossa, and in fut. sasóssa.
Masishien, or mosishien, mi, ma, osishiena, neutr. the root sûminashies, notched, indented. as certain plants. Paûsishies, to make notches, act. et trans. nom, shien, verbum, sishien, to notch.
Moot, minoot, mamoot, ootta, ootten, inoot, inoóoten, to measure.
Mota, minóta, mamóta, ota, iota jo iota, mo-iota, to vomit. Dummocha, idem.
Motákkotákko, minótakkótakko, mamotakkotakko, same as mopakkopakko.

Motarram, mi, ma, otárrara, neutr. high land. Paûtarrar, to exalt, imp. aûtarrar, aûtarraran, inautárraran, inoautarraran, ipaûtarrara, pas. ipaûtarrar, inipaûtarrar, inoipaûtarrar; tarrar, height of land, neutr. autarra, a rise. act. ma-autarrar, an exalter.
Motó, a corner, a shop.
Motozysha, mi, ma, to be all day about a thing, as motozysha bachinan tummaap, to work the whole day with a fever. Paûtozysha, trans.
Mottti, wearied, done up, mi, ma.
Móûpl, minotûp, mamûtûp. imp. otûppa, the going out of a candle or fire: also the healing of a wound. Neutraliter, &c. Patúp, act. Paûtûp, trans.
Msan, soft, easily cut, also hoarse.
中文: 軟的，容易切開的，嘶啞的

釋義: Msásan ja pattite, to speak hoarse.
Naán, the name.
Náas, the roof of the mouth.
Nai, a mother, an aunt, with the addition of the name. Nai pattalam, a stepmother.
中文: 媽媽，阿姨（作爲名字的附加）

釋義: Naida, how many, plur."naidaida.
Na-ies, the bowels.
Ndito, seven.
Námo, we, differs from torro, because torro, includes those with whom we speak, but namo, not so.
Nasa, by and bye, used only of the future. but people join it to ani, as aninasa, and relating the past, men write naasa.
Náttá, one.
Nattagsár, a handbreadth;like nárroag, sar, natorro agsar, &c. a gripe, a hand full, from gûmmesar.
Naaûpoot, linen.
Naûqúa, a buck, a he goat.
Nok, snot.
Nok o rimi, the white of an egg.
Nok o baron, resin, gum.
Nomósnos, minomosmos, mamomosaos. nosmossa, nosmossen, inosmos, inonasmossen, to smell after something.
Nomosnos, onummijonor, what do you smell, or snuff after.
Nono, a rasberry; written Noenó, this is plural. Noeno babo, is a smaller berry. Noeno gagil, a larger berry, like the rasberry,
Not, the nose.
Nûmma, what ?
Nummochi, minummochi, manûmmochi, nochia, nochian, inochian, to knit one's brow, to purse up one's mouth.
O, a strong drink, used by the natives.
Obó, a claw. From Pa-obo.
Obon, a hen-coop.
Ochal, eneugh, sufficient, praet. inochal, fut. ino-ochál. Hence the verb, paochal, pi, pa, imp. ipaochalla, pas. ipaochal, inipaochal, to satisfy, to pay.
Ocho, a louse.
Odá, the intestines.
Odar, fine split rattan, died red, which people wind round the spears, darts, &c. but when painted red it is called acho.
Odor, the breast bone.
Oéba, sleepy, drowsy.
Oebásan, a deer. Sobóchen, a buck that has shed his horns. Tûmmokko, one whose horns begin to grow.
Oedán, what then & how then?
Oéla, hoar frost.
Oéno, the head, handle, or hilt.
Oeno abi, a bundle of areca nuts.
Oeraas, grey hair, greyness. Ma-aûraas, a grey-headed old man. Oeraassen, inoeraas, to become grey.
Oetás, rain.
Ogga, a cloth for the loins.
Oggaen, a sinew, a vein.
Oggom, an ant.
Olla, as chadsia.
Omarrimárrais, an eructation.
Ombo, minobó, mamobó, oboa, oboam, inoboam, ino-oboan, to smell; activ. it is written Mibo. Aûbo, smell; other wise Ombo, is to thatch a house with grass, as dûmmalap, and gummeoch.
Ombarri, minobarri, mamobarri, obarria, obarrian, invbarria, inoabarria, to stand; the (o) short bitten off.
Omparachpach, (the o short) mino, maampar, iparachpacha, the being free, or not cleaving to anything, opposite to Maggo.
Omicho, never, never again.
Onad, a flame. From ponnad, or monad.
Oob, the soot of the chimney, Hence Ooben, inoob, ino-ooben, blackened with soot. Pa-oob, to cover with soot.
Oóg, a bamboo.
Oos, a drum.
Oót, the bones. Ma-ooten, to be bony.
Orachan, tired.
Oras, grey hairs. Hence oeraássen, inoeraas, ino-oerassen, to become grey.
Orien, is said of any thing that falls in to the eyes and occasions inconve nience: hence people say respecting the eyes, Orian, inorinan.
Oroán, as ra-o, a well.
Oroboa, the chin.
Orrum, a wind instrument where with they play; not unlike the trumpet.
Orrûm a macha, the apple of the eye.
Osi, white.
Osi, a shelter.
Osian, a refuge, from pási.
Osó, a tortoise.
Osds, the tresses of hair, whether worn by the Chinese or natives. Also the bushy tops of the long grass, which are tied together to frighten animals.
Otáttan, otattea, to do things moderately.
Otaútattán, Otaûtattea, as otattan.

Pa, a word of denial. Patzi, there is no fish. Joined with nouns, it means to make, as pacha-och, to make a grave.Also to do ary thing, as paûcho, to louse; but mixed with other words it means to cause to do, as Papiech, to cause to fight unjustly. Pabórra, to pacify; or to suspect or accuse any one, as pachab, to accuse of theft. Pachod, one who raises an unjust suspicion.
pina. papa. aû, pass. a-en, ina, inoa-en, to rub a sore limb with a warm handkerchief, &c.
中文: 用溫暖的手巾搓揉很痠的四肢

釋義: pina-ach, papa-ach, ipa-ach.-a, ipa-ach, inipa-ach, inoipa-ach, to roast
pi, pa, a-aga, a-agan, ina-aga, ino-agûn, to cough, a-aga, a cough
pi, pa, aarda, aarden, inaard, inoaarden, the binding up of the hair of females. Aard, the tresses of women; also the binding of the same

pinûarpa, papûarpa, aarpa, ipa-arpa,
ûarpanni, inûarpan, inoaarpanni, to join one's self to any society. Cho Abasshe pinaarpó Batshekan, those of Abasshe have joined with Batshekan. Paarpa o dippi, to weld iron together. Nota, paarpa requires that the ends come over or into one another. See summasoom.

pinas, papas, bûssa, bûssin, binas, inobassin, to stop one in any thing; to dissuade; also to carry a message. Tomada cho pinûas o assabûn, inachas ja o badda ernerren, who has informed the village, that the men of Favorlang have been beaten? Pabûs, trans. babas, a message. Ma-ababas, a messenger.
中文: 阻止某人做某事；勸退；傳遞訊息

釋義: Takeis, pi, pa, a-arrosa. Patûttotûtto, terneren, pi, pa, atuttotûttoa, the trembing and shaking of one, when slung in a sling.
中文: 顫抖及搖晃〈指當在吊索上搖晃的樣子〉

釋義: (let the last a be scarcely heard), pinass, papû-as, a-ûssa, to sneeze; a-ûssen, inû-as, ino-a-assen, a sneezing.
pinaspot, papaspot, ipaspotta, ipaspot, inipaspot, inoipaspot, to occasion any one work or trouble, to bother, trans. from maspot, which see.
中文: 招致給某人工作或麻煩

釋義: pinaba, pûpaba, abaya, to give to understand, to inform, to reveal, to tell, to proclaim.Trans. from maba, which see. Parti. abaijen, inabaijen, inoabaijen, abanni, this participle is used with respect to the person who is informed; ipaba, inipaba, with respect to the business which is told.
pina-attat, papa-attat, to stammer, written Pa-at-at. Ternere, pa-ap-ap. Takeis, pamaama, imp. at-atta.
pinabach-ich, papûbach-ich, abach-icha, abach-ichen, inabachich, inoabach-ichen, to unbend, to unteam. From ipabach-icha, inipabachich &c. trans. from Mabach-ich, which see.
pinabarrabarra, papabarrabarra, ipabarrabarra, inipabarrabarra, to strip one naked. Trans. from parrabarra, which see.
pinûbechab, papabechab, abechabba, abechabben, inabechabben, inoabechabben, to cover anyone with a coverlet, also to cover one's self. Bûbechap, a covering.
中文: 以棉被〈或類似物〉蓋住某人；蓋住自己

釋義: pinabarras, papabarras, ipabarasa, to let loose. Trans. from parras, which see. Ma-ababarras, a redeemer. Ca Christus paga ma-ababarras o babosa, Christ the redeemer of mankind. Babarras, redemption.
pinûbasso, papabasso, ipabassoa, ipabasso, inipabasso, to make strings. Trans. from passo, which see.
and pabasoes, see Passos.
pi, pa, abich-ia, abichi-in, inabich-i, to sparkle with water, as pashipie; abichi, nom. a sprinklling.
pinaboas, papaboas, ipabóasa, ipaboas, inipaboas, inoipabóas, to remove. Trans. from maboas, which see.
pinabot, papabot, abotta, abottan, inabottan, inoabottan, to put on shoes (this with respect to the feet, but with regard to the shoe, abot, inabot, inoabot;) ipabotta, ipabot, &c.

pinûchanach, papûchanagh, to place the arrow in the bow. Ipachûn-agha; changed, with regard to the arrow, into ipachanagh, inipachanagh, inoipachanagh: but with respect to the bow, achan-aghan, inachan-aghan, inoachan-aghan, see the root chûmanagh.
pinacharod, papacharod, acharoda, acharoddan, inacharoddan, inoacharoddan, to put on stockings, trans. from chummarod, which see.

pinacheo-ach, papacheo-ach, cheo-acha, cheo-achen, chineo-ach, inocheo-achen, to come again, to return, to give back. Also applied to the mind, when it retires into itself, or withdraws itself from any thing.
中文: 回來；返來；給回；〈心靈〉退卻；抽離

釋義: pinachip, papachip, achippa, achippan, inachip, inochipan, ipachippa, ipachip, inipachip, inoipachip, to add to. Chachip, an addition, nom.

pinabechibechi, inopabechibechi, abechibechia, inabechibechi, inoabechibechi, the person for whom; abechibechian, inabechibechian, inoabechibechian, to swing any thing backwards and forwards, Act. ipûbechibechia, ipabechibechi, inipabechibechi, inoipabechibechi.
pi, pa, ipaboorena, the flowing of blood, act. borren ja tagga, to let blood.
pi, pa, achabbechûbba, said of the birds as they move their wings in the flight, and thus beat the air. Chabbechab, nom. subat.
中文: 描述鳥類飛行時振動翅膀，拍擊空氣

釋義: pi, pa, achichichichia, to hiss, as hot iron put into the water.
中文: 當熱鐵放進水中的嘶嘶作響聲

釋義: pinûchiech, papûchiech, achicha, achichen, inachiech, inoachichen, to roast. Trans. from chummiech.
pi, pa, achirrabba, achirrabban, inachirrabban, to insert any thing in between where things adhere; can be suitably employed for ingrafting, or incorporating.
中文: 在事物黏接出插入任何東西

釋義: pi, pa, achitchitta, achitchitten, inachitchit, to beat as the arteries or the heart. Ma-achitchit ja oggach, an artery.
中文: 像是動脈或是心臟那樣跳動

釋義: pinûchote, papûchote, chotea, chotein, chinote, to punish.
pinûd, papûd, badda, baddaan, binaddan, linen, or such like stuff.
pi, pa, adûata, adatten, inadûat, inoadûatten, ipadûata, ipadaat, inipûdaat, inoipadaat, to do any thing early in the morning, as chûmda. Padadaat, intende. nom.ûdaat betimes.
pinadûch-o-dûch-o, papadûch-o-dûch-o, adach-o-dach-oa, to wander through the country.
pinadûkkodakko, papadakkodakko, adakkodakkoa, to nod with sleep.
pinûddabo, papûddabo, addabóa, addaboan, inaddabóan, inoaddaboan, to keep one's self entrenched or secreted. Ma-addabo, a concealer.
pinaddach, papaddach, addûcha, to end, to leave off.
pinaddat, papaddat, addada, addadden, inadadden, inoadadden, to hew or cut any thing into pieces.
pinûddam, papûddam, addammen, inaddûman, inoaddamman, to eat the paddy, or rice, in the field, as is sometimed done by wild animals.
中文: 如同野獸，在田園中吃稻、米

釋義: pinûddidi, padûddidi, addidia, to shiver as one in an ague. Paddidi, a shien, to chatter with the teeth.
meagre
pi, pa, addikka, to over... long grass hangs over the pa...

pinûddopo, papûddopo, addûppoa, to stoop forward; als ... forward with the head resting ... thing; thus addopóan,
inaddopoan, inoaddopoan. Paaddûppo, imp. ipaaddûppoa. Favorlang, paggûppo, trans. ipaagguppoa.
pinadirdir, papadirdir, adirdirra, to tremble, act. from Madirdir.
pinadoch, pûpadoch, adóch-a, adochen, inadoch, inoadochen, ... a rap, as at the door. Padóch-doch, to rap frequently.
pi, pa, adûlloa, adûlloan, inadûlloan, inoadûlloan, to strive ... who shall finish first.

to be, to have; it is also ... es pa, and in this sense is do ... pagaga, by no means, pret. ... fut. pûgaga, imp. ûga-a; item ... when, without question. Pa ... rosono de bonna, there is a ... field. Paga means quantity.

pi, pa, ipaga-a, ipaga, ... to cause to be. e.g. ja alli oa inipaga, is it not you that has done it? that is, have you not caused it to be? Ga, essence, a being, Agaijan, the place where any thing is, as agaijan ota Deos, contradicted from agaûta Deos, the place where God is.
pi, pa, agagagaga-a, pagagagaga-o-to, to gurgle with water.
pinagalgal, papagalgal, agalgalla, to pant.
a little time, a minute.
pinaggeas, papaggeas, aggeassa, to strech one's self, as yawners do
pi, pa, agasanna. agasannan, inagasan, inoagasannan, to love. Agasan, desire, love. Ma-agasan, a lover.
pinaggi, papaggi, aggia, the snarling of dogs.
pinagoegoe, the ranging of the wind and sea, the rumbling of thunder or of the belly. Pagoegoegoegoe, intd.
中文: 風或海的狂暴；轟雷聲；肚子轟隆作響

釋義: pi, pa, agorgorra, to snore.
pi, pa, the cooing of doves.
pi, pa, the pain of the stomach, imp. aichiecha, pass. aichiechen, inaichiech, inoaichiechen.

in act. trans. imp. aichamma babosa, aichamman, inaichamman, inoaichamman,
ipaichamma, pas. pichamman, inichamman, inoichûmman, ipaicham, inipaicham, inoipûìcham, to drink, to offer to drink, aichan, nom. a drinking; ûichaman, a drinking cup.
pinaichasrra, papaichasarra, for the imp. people say, sarra o kagil, to sleep.
pinaies, papaies, aisa, ipaies, inipaies, inoipaies, to put away.
pinaya, papaya, aya, ayanni, inayanni, inoayanni, to lean backwards.
pinûyach, papayach, ayacha, ayachen, inayach, inoayachen, whence iachen, ipayach, iniachen, inipayach, inoipayach, to make dirty.
pinayoch, papayoch, ayocha, to turn back, also ayochan, inayochan, inoayochan, to give back.
pinaikiek, papaikiek, to crack.
pi, pa, idem.
trans. from Mikkap, which see.
pinûilieb, papûilieb, ailieba, ailieban, inailiban, inoailiban, to call, to fetch any one. Paailieb, imp. ipaûiliba, trans. nom. ailieb, a calling.
intend.
pinaior, papaior, aiorra, aiorren, inaiorren, inoaiorren, to precede any ... to shew the way; the way, aiorran, inaiorran, inoaiorran.
pinairas, papairas, airasû, ipairasa, to be stubborn in any thing, ipairas, inipairas, inoipairas, as pàsies, nom. airas, as asies.
trans. from meroos, which see.
pinais, papais, aisa, aisan, inaisan, inoaisan, to pester.
pi, pa, to whistle thro' the teeth.
pinûita, papûita, ipaita, to show; ... ? ipaita, inipaitû, inoipaita; to ... ? aitanni, inaitanni, inoaitanni, trans. from Mita, which see.
pi, pa, bajussa, bajussen. binûjús, inobajûssen, to blow a gale, to storm. Pabajûs, trans. Bajûs, nom. a storm.
pinakaqûa, papakaqûa, aka-qua-a, akaqûa-an, inakaqûa, inoakaqûa-an, to do any thing moderately, ... ipakaqua-a, ipakaqua, inipakaqûa, inoipakaqûa, nom. qûa, a little, moderate, akaqûa, diminution.
pinakaûkaû, papakaùkaû, akaûkaûa, akaûkaûan, inakaûkaûan, inoûkaûkaûan, to bawl out loud.
pi, pa, akeassa, akéassan, inakeas, inoakéassan, to stick out one leg behind, as kûmmitta.
pi, pa, ipakeassû, ipakeûs, inipakeûs, inoipakeas, to do as above, nam. akeûs, the sticking out of the leg.
pinakibokibo, papakibokibo, akibokiboa, to flutter, trans. from kummibokibo, which see.
pi, pa, akikkekikkea, to swarm, as pakikkekikke tsi. binnan.
pi, pa, imp. akkarótta, to crack. Pakarot, trans. nom. karot, cracked.
pi, pa, imp. akillekillea, to rattle, but so as that a ringing is heard, as from money, or the rings on the arms. Differs from paseerseer.
中文: 以搖動的方式讓鈴響被聽到

釋義: pinakkio, papakkio, akkio, akkioa, the cry of deer.
pi, pa, akkolla, to dig deep.
pinakobos, papakobos, akobossa, akobossan, inakobossan, inoakobossan, to hunt with nets, also ipakobossa, ipakonos, inipakobos.
pi, pa, akotkótta, the cackling of hens.

(let the last letter be scarcely heard) pinala, papûla, ipûla, alûnni, inalanni, inoalanni, to say, to tell. Ala, nomen, a saying. This noun is compounded of karri, as karri ala, and mau, as mau ala, to converse together.
trans. from Malla, which see.
pinalablabg, papalûblabg, alablûbba, alablabban, inalûblabban, inoalablabban, to fan with a fan.
pinalachach, papalachach, alachacha, alachachen, inalachach, inoalachachen, the opposite of Padidden. See Malachach, of which this is the transitive.
means also to make any thing loose, to put loosely together; but then ipalachacha, ipalachach, inipalachach, inoipalachach.
中文: 使鬆脫；鬆鬆地放在一起

釋義: pinalalat, papalalat, balabalata, binalabalat, balalabalatten, iiiobalabalatten, to put things in a row, or side by side. Palalat ja se malam o bausies; it differs from Palat, see Pûlalat, pinûlalat, pûpalalat, ipalalatta, ipûlalat, inipûlalat, inoipalalat, to arrange in a row, add thereto, balûlat, the noun.
trans. from lûmmapilapies, of malapilapies, which see.

pinûlat, papûlat, balatta, balatten, binalat, inobalatten, as palûlat, except that palat, extends itself to the conveying, but taken transitively, ipalûtta, ipalat, inipalat, add thereto, balat, the noun.
中文: 把東西放成一直排，但有涉及運送方面

釋義: pinalaûlaûb, papalaûlaûb, laûlaûba, laûlaûban, linaûlaûban, &c.
trans. from Mallakkûm
pallidóllido, pinallidóllido, papallidóllido, allidollidóa, allidollidoan, inallidollidóan, inoallidollidoan, to run backwards and forwards, spoken also of a crooked way, pallidollidoa taran.
pi, pa, allilla, pas. allillen, inallil, inoallillen, as maûchûs, matsipi, to roar and tear. Pallillil, intend. pallil.
trans. allil, a noise.

pi, pa, imp. ûlloa, to reach to, to reach any thing to any one, is also used for the giving of a pledge of marriage, as &c. as the Formosans are sometimes accustomed to do. Palo, trans. nom. allo, a reaching out, a pledge, which is given as a pledge of acon tract.
pinallossa, pûpallossa, allossa, allossanni, inallossanni, inoallossanni, to discover or reveal a little to any one.
中文: 發現或是揭示〈某事〉給某人

釋義: pinalololullo, papalololullo, allolulloan, inalololulloan, inoalololulloan, to make a noise, as by the feet of those who tread hard, or as from a shower of rain; poeple say, palololullo ja oetas.

pinamamma, papûmamma, ûmamma, to cover a field with grass; what ? amammamanni and amammayan, inamammûnni and inamammayan, inoamammanni and inoammammayan, wherewith? ipàmamma, inipamamnia, inoipamamnia.
ameeûa, the mewing of cats.
pi‚ pa‚ amoggimoggia, amoggimoggien, inamoggimoggien, inoamoggimoggien, to murmur, to mumble. Amoggimoggi, a murmuring. Ma-amoggimoggi, a murmurer.

some whither, to some place, pana Baziekan, to Batsjekan, sometimes de is added, as pana de Taiwan, to Taiwan. It is also a verb, and has in the in praet. pinana, in fut. papûna, in imperat. ûna, act. ipana, trans.
pinan, pûpan, banna, bannan, binannan, inobannan, to stop up with earth. Pûban, pinaban, papaban, ipabanna, ipaban, inipaban, inoipaban, to do thus; baban, a dam.
pinannab, papannab, anabba, what ? annabben, inannab, inoannabben, where with ? ûnnaban, inannaban, inoannaban, the washing of the hands,
pinûnno, pananno; annoa, to dress one's self, what ? annoan, inûnnoan, inoannoan, wherewith ? ipanno, inipanno, inoipanno. Pano, trans.
pi, pa, the singing of musquitoes.
pinano, papano, to clothe another; what or who ? anoan, inamoan, inoanoan; wherewith ? ipûno, inipûno, inoipûno; see panno, a little above.
pinanokkonokko, papanokkonokko, annokkonokkoa, annokkonokkoan, or anni, or aijan, inanokkonokkoan, inoanokkonokkoan, to intreat. Annoggonoggo, an intreaty.
a-oa-oû-a, the cry of crows.

(the first a short, to distinguish it from Pû-oabi, to cause to sow;) pina-oabi, papa-óabi, a-óabia, a-óabi, inaoabi, to sow the fields; thus ûo-abian, inaoabian. Babósa, pa-oabi, the sower; adda ipa-oûbi, it is sown; Bonnaaoabian, it was sown. Aoûbi, a sowing. Aoûbian, aoabi aijan, the sowing season, or place.
pina-obo, papa-obo, a-obóa, a-ó-boan, inaóboan, inoa-óboan, to clue, to clue up, to draw up into a clue; also ipaóboa, ipa-obó, inipa-obo.
a pairing.
an oyster.
pinapapûdda, papapûdda, apapûdda, apapaddan, inipapaddan, inoipapaddan, to wash the feet, wherewith ? apapaddanni, or ayan, inapapaddanni, inoapapaddanni.
from Mûpappa, which see.
from Mapil, which see.
apillepillikka, to clap together, as two hands, two planks, &c.

pinûra, papara, arû, arûn, inara, inoaran, to be with any one, to accompany; araosse ta Cabba oe, does Cabba keep company? Ara, a comrade, pas. aran, inaran, to be accompanied: this passive is used with respect to those who attend on any one, as Takaba aran o Takalla, i.e. Takabba is waited on by Takala; or Takaba inara o icho, i. e. Takabba is attended by him; and aran, is also taken for the person who serves, that is the servant and maid.

pinarab, paparab, iparaba, to impregnate, to get with child: see rummab, the transitive of which this is, and means, to impregnate, or to cause a woman to be pregnant, while rummab, betokens the receiver. And raben, the child; rinab is received.

pinaraba, papûraba, ara, aran, inara, inoaran, from Para, to adopt as a child, also to give up for that purpose; in which case it is ipûraba-a, iparaba. Paraba, act. and trans. The child rûmmaka, takes another for his father. The real father lets the child be taken by another. Paraba choa, refers to those who take the child; it is also said Paraba, to take a child. An adopted father raba amosjiem. The real father iparabo. The child is called by the adopten father, aran.
pinarûllibal, paparûllibal, baralliballa, barûllibal, binarallibal, inobarallibal, to put out linen, &c. to dry. But has not such an extensive meaning as porra; pabarallibal, to do thus.
from rûmmapies, which see.
from mûrar, which see.
pinarid, papûrid, aridden, inarid, inoaridden, the place or part from whence, ariddan, inariddan, inoariddan, to dry up, activ. see Marid, neutr.
from Marara, which see.
from rûmmaût, which see.
from rûmmaûrat, which see.
pinardosan, papardosan, to choke, as those do, who take the food or drink the wrong way. Paardosan, ipinaardosan, papaardosan, ipaardosana, &c. to do so.
中文: 嗆到〈以不正常的飲食方式才嗆到〉

釋義: pi, pa, imp. ûresshia, aresshi-in, inaresshi, inoaresshi-in, pas. iparesshi, to set up to fight, aresshi, nom. a setting on. Ma-aresshi, one who sets on.
pinûriaut, papûriaût, ariauta, ariaûtan, inariaut, inoariaut, to fill, to make full. Also to let fill, in which case ipariaûta, ipariaut, ariaut, nom.
as rûmmiggo, pinariggo, papariggo, ariggoa, ariggoan, inariggo, inoariggoan, ariggoan: see Mariggo.

pinatikoriko, paparikoriko, rikorikoa, rikorikoan, rinikorikoan, to share any thing, to wave it backwards and forwards, or let such be done, in which case it is iparikorikoa, iparikoriko, iniparikoriko, &c.
see rûmmikak.
pinario, papûrio, arióa, arióan, &c. to make good. Mario, arió, an improving, a making good.
pi, pa, imp. arrióriotta, from Parriot, to see below; is said of ivy, &c. which climbs up long sticks or trees, and embraces them.
a clear sky.
pi, pa, arokaila, pass. arokailen, inarokail, to lay the hands or feet over each other.
中文: 把手和腳放在彼此〈身上〉

釋義: pinarne, paparne, iparnea, ipûrne as rûmne. Paûrne, see rûmmene.
aroba, pass. aroban, inaroban, inoaroban ja bonna, to strew, to spread out dry things.
